English Sentences: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hageeti Israa7eela Kawuwaa Daawita na7aa Solomona leemisota.

English Sentences: To know wisdom and instruction; to perceive the words of understanding;
Wolaitta Sentences: Leemisoti asai aadhdhida eratettaa, seeraanne era haasayaa akeekanau maaddoosona.

English Sentences: To receive the instruction of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and equity;
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti aadhdhida eratettan, de7ana de7uwaa, xillotettaa, suure pirddaanne suuretettaa tamaarissiyaageeta,

English Sentences: To give subtilty to the simple, to the young man knowledge and discretion.
Wolaitta Sentences: hiillaa erennaageeta erissiyaageeta, wodallatussi eratettaanne adussa qofaa immiyaageeta.

English Sentences: A wise man will hear, and will increase learning; and a man of understanding shall attain unto wise counsels:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchati ha leemisota siyidi, eraa gujjoosona; akeekanchcha asatikka lo77o zoriyaa ekkoosona.

English Sentences: To understand a proverb, and the interpretation; the words of the wise, and their dark sayings.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadan leemisotanne eta birshshettaa, aadhdhida eranchchatu haasayaanne eta qan77isheta akeekanau danddayettees.

English Sentences: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaassi doomettai GODAASSI yayyiyoogaa; shin eeyyati aadhdhida eratettaanne seeraa karoosona.

English Sentences: My son, hear the instruction of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, ne aawaa zoriyaa ezgga; ne aayyiyaa tamaarissiyoogaakka karoppa.

English Sentences: For they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy head, and chains about thy neck.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegee ne huuphiyau bonchcho kallachcha; ne qooriyaukka gozdda gidana.

English Sentences: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, nena nagaranchchati balettikko, eeno gooppa.

English Sentences: If they say, Come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti nena, "Nunaara hindda; asa woranau zuggidi naagoos; gaasoi xayikkonne xillota woranau qosetti uttoos;

English Sentences: Let us swallow them up alive as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:
Wolaitta Sentences: Si7oolee mittiyoogaadan, nuunikka eta paxa de7ishin mittoos; nuuni eta ciimma ollan oliyo asatudan oottana.

English Sentences: We shall find all precious substance, we shall fill our houses with spoil:
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni al77o miishsha ubbaa demmana; demmidi nu keettaa omooduwan kunttana;

English Sentences: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:
Wolaitta Sentences: nunaara zuppeta; demmidobaakka issippe shaakkana" yaagana.

English Sentences: My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, etaara ogiyaa hemettoppa; ne tohuwaa eta loossuwaa yettoppa.

English Sentences: For their feet run to evil, and make haste to shed blood.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, eti iitabaa oottanau woxxoosona; asaa suuttaa gussanau jaamoosona.

English Sentences: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kafoi xeellishin, a oiqqanau gitiyaa yeggiyoogee ainne maaddenna.

English Sentences: And they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privily for their own lives.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin eti bantta suuttaa gussanau zuggoosona; bantta shemppuwaa woranau qosetti uttoosona.

English Sentences: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain; which taketh away the life of the owners thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Geniyan go77aa demmiya ubbatu wurssettai hegaa mala; he aawu shemppuwaa ekkees.

English Sentences: Wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voice in the streets:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettiyaa ogiyan xeesausu; dere gutaran ba qaalaa xoqqu oottada alaahausu.

English Sentences: She crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the openings of the gates: in the city she uttereth her words, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettiyaa asai shiiqiyo sohuwan eqqada xeesausu; katamaa geliyo penggiyan eqqada, hagaadan yaagada biddausu;

English Sentences: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and fools hate knowledge?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Inttenoo, akeekai paccidoogeetoo, intte akeekaa pacaa aude gakkanaashin dosuuteetii? Qilliicciyaageetoo, qilliicciyoogan aude gakkanaashin ufaittuuteetii? Eeyyatoo, eratettaa aude gakkanaassi ixxuuteetii?

English Sentences: Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta seeran simmite; be7ite; taani ta eraa intte bolli gussana; ta qaalaakka inttena tamaarissana.

English Sentences: Because I have called, and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no man regarded;
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani xeesido wode, intte koyennan ixxideta; taani kushiyaa yeddinkka, ooninne akeekibeenna.

English Sentences: But ye have set at nought all my counsel, and would none of my reproof:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta zore ubbaa karideta; ta seeraakka ekkibeekketa.

English Sentences: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, inttena metoi gakkiyo wode, taani intte bolli miiccana; intte dagaman kokkoriyo wode, taani inttena qilliiccana.

English Sentences: When your fear cometh as desolation, and your destruction cometh as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish cometh upon you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dagamai uushuwaadan intte bolli yiyo wode, metoi gotiyaadan intte bolli yiyo wode, tuggainne waayee intte bolli gakkiyo wode, taani inttena qilliiccana.

English Sentences: Then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:
Wolaitta Sentences: "He wode eti tana xeesana; shin taani koyikke; eti tana minttidi koyana; shin demmokkona.

English Sentences: For that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear of the LORD:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, eti eratettaa ixxidosona; GODAASSI yayyiyoogaa dooribookkona.

English Sentences: They would none of my counsel: they despised all my reproof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta zoriyaa ekkibookkona; ta seera ubbaakka karidosona.

English Sentences: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, eti bantta oottido oosuwaa aifiyaa maana; bantta halchchido halchchuwaa aifiyaakka kallana.

English Sentences: For the turning away of the simple shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeekai paccidoogeeta aadhdhida eratettaappe haakkiyoogee worees; eeyyata shenehoo giyoogee xaissees.

English Sentences: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani odiyoogaa siyiyaageeti ubbai woppu giidi, saro de7ana; metuwaa hirggaappekka shemppana" yaagausu.

English Sentences: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, and hide my commandments with thee;
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, neeni ta giyoogaa ekka; ta azazuwaakka ne giddon minjja.

English Sentences: So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom, and apply thine heart to understanding;
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaa ezgga; ne wozanaappe akeeka.

English Sentences: Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, and liftest up thy voice for understanding;
Wolaitta Sentences: Eratettaa xeesa; akeekaassikka xoqqu oottada alaaha.

English Sentences: If thou seekest her as silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures;
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi biraa woikko qosido miishshaa koyiyoogaadan, neeni eratettaa koya.

English Sentences: Then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD, and find the knowledge of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode neeni GODAASSI yayyiyoogaa giyoogee aibakko akeekana; Xoossaakka loittada erana.

English Sentences: For the LORD giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, GODAI aadhdhida eratettaa immees; appe eratettainne akeekoi beettees.

English Sentences: He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
Wolaitta Sentences: I suuretussi maaddiya zoriyaa minjjees; boree bainnan hemettiyaageetassikka i gonddalle.

English Sentences: He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tumaa pirddiyaageetu ogiyaa naagees; ba ammanettiyaageetu ogiyaakka naagees.

English Sentences: Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and equity; yea, every good path.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode neeni xillotettaa, suure pirddaa, suuretettaanne lo77o ooso ubbaa erana.

English Sentences: When wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, neeni aadhdhida eranchcha gidana; ne eratettaikka nena ufaissana.

English Sentences: Discretion shall preserve thee, understanding shall keep thee:
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena adussi qoppiyoogee naagana; akeekoikka nena saro ashshana.

English Sentences: To deliver thee from the way of the evil man, from the man that speaketh froward things;
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettai nena iita asatu balaappe naagana; geellabaa haasayiyaageetuppekka ashshana.

English Sentences: Who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti nagaraa xuman de7anau, xillotettaa ogiyaa aggoosona.

English Sentences: Who rejoice to do evil, and delight in the frowardness of the wicked;
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitaa oottiyoogan ufaittoosona; geellaban hashshu goosona.

English Sentences: Whose ways are crooked, and they froward in their paths:
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti oottiyoogee mirqqetta; eta de7oikka geella.

English Sentences: To deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with her words;
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettai shaaramuxa maccaaseeppenne sheleeshshiya qaalan haasayiya laggetteeppe nena ashshana.

English Sentences: Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ba naatettaa azinaa aggaagausu; ba Xoossaa sinttan maacettido maachchaakka dogausu.

English Sentences: For her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead.
Wolaitta Sentences: I soo biyoogee haiqqanau biyoogaa; ikko biyoogee haiqqida asai biidosaa kaalettees.

English Sentences: None that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the paths of life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ikko biya oonikka guyye simmenna; de7uwaa ogiyaakka demmenna.

English Sentences: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths of the righteous.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa aggada, neeni lo77o asatu leemisuwaa kaalla; xillo asatu de7uwaakka qulla.

English Sentences: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, suure asatinne boree bainna asati biittan gam77idi de7ana.

English Sentences: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin iitati biittaappe xoqollettana; ammanttennaageetikka shodettidi xayana.

English Sentences: My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my commandments:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, taani nena tamaarissiyoogaa dogoppa; ta azazotakka ne wozanan wotta.

English Sentences: For length of days, and long life, and peace, shall they add to thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, eti ne bariyaa adussana; ishalo de7uwaakka neeyyo gujjana.

English Sentences: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aggenna siiqoinne tumatettai neeppe haakkoppona; eta ne qooriyan qachcha; ne wozanankka eta xaafa.

English Sentences: So shalt thou find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatikko, neeni Xoossaanne asaa sinttan sabettananne nashettana.

English Sentences: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne polo wozanan GODAA ammanetta; ne akeekan zemppoppa.

English Sentences: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni oottiyo ooso ubban a sinttaya; i nena likke ogiyaa kaalettana.

English Sentences: Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena ne huuphen aadhdhida eranchcha kessoppa; GODAASSI yayya; iitaappekka haakka.

English Sentences: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegee ne bollaa payya wottana; ne meqettaakka xallana.

English Sentences: Honour the LORD with thy substance, and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAA ne duretettan bonchcha; koiro aifida katta ubbaappekka xeeraa ayyo immiyoogan a bonchcha.

English Sentences: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatikko, ne gootaratun kattai kumana; ne baattaakka aife woine eessai kumidi palahana.

English Sentences: My son, despise not the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, GODAA seeraa karoppa; i nena qaxxayiyo wodekka lanccoppa.

English Sentences: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, aawai ba siiqiyo na7aa seeriyoogaadan, GODAI ba ufaittiyo uraa seerees.

English Sentences: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaa demmiya urai, akeekaakka babaa oottiya urai anjjettidaagaa.

English Sentences: For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, appe demmiyo go77ai biraappe demmiyo go77aappe aadhdhees; appe beettiya go77ai worqqaappe beettiya go77aappe kehees.

English Sentences: She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettai inqquwaappe keehi al77o; neeni demmanau amottiyo ubbai aadhdhida eratettaara likkettenna.

English Sentences: Length of days is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches and honour.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettai ne bariyaa adussees; i neeyyo duretettaanne bonchchuwaa gujjees.

English Sentences: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ogeti ufaissiya ogeta; a loosso ubbaikka saro.

English Sentences: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retaineth her.
Wolaitta Sentences: I bana oiqqiyaageetussi de7o mitta; a mintti oiqqiya ubbatikka anjjettidaageeta.

English Sentences: The LORD by wisdom hath founded the earth; by understanding hath he established the heavens.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI ba aadhdhida eratettan sa7aa medhdhiis; ba akeekankka salota minttiis.

English Sentences: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the clouds drop down the dew.
Wolaitta Sentences: A eratettan shaafati goggoosona; shaaratuppekka irai bukkees.

English Sentences: My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom and discretion:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, lo77o aadhdhida eratettaanne adussi qoppiyoogaa naaga; eti neeppe shaahettoppona.

English Sentences: So shall they be life unto thy soul, and grace to thy neck.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti neeyyo de7o gidana; eti neeyyo ishalonne ufaissa de7uwaa immana.

English Sentences: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode neeni ne ogiyan hirggi bainnan hemettana; ne tohoikka xubettenna.

English Sentences: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni zin77ido wode, yayyakka; zin77adakka mal77o xiskkuwaa xiskkana.

English Sentences: Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeekennan gakkiya bashshau, woikko iitati xayiyo xayuwau yayyakka.

English Sentences: For the LORD shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, GODAI neeyyo ammanettiyaagaa gidana; ne gedeekka piriyan oiqettennaadan, i nena naagana.

English Sentences: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeyyo wolqqai de7ishin, metootidaagau lo77obaa oottiyoogaa aggoppa.

English Sentences: Say not unto thy neighbour, Go, and come again, and to morrow I will give; when thou hast it by thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha77i neeyyo de7ishin, ne shooruwaayyo, "Simmada ya; taani neeyyo wontto immana" yaagoppa.

English Sentences: Devise not evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwelleth securely by thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nenan ammanettidi, ne matan de7ishin, ne shooruwaa bolli iitabaa oottanau halchchoppa.

English Sentences: Strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no harm.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena naaqqibeenna asa, coo mootoppa.

English Sentences: Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sugetta oottiya asata qulloppa; eta iita oosuwaakka kaalloppa.

English Sentences: For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but his secret is with the righteous.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, GODAI iitaa oottiyaageeta ixxees; shin suuretuyyo i ulottees.

English Sentences: The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked: but he blesseth the habitation of the just.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAA qanggettai iitaa oottiyaageetu soona; shin a anjjoi suurebaa haniyaageetu soona.

English Sentences: Surely he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the lowly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Otorettidi qilliicciyaageeta GODAIKKA qilliiccees; shin banttana kaushshiyaageeta nashshees.

English Sentences: The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchati bonchchuwaa demmana; shin eeyyati kauyyana.

English Sentences: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta naatoo, intte aawaa zoriyaa siyite; loitti ezggite; yaatikko, intte akeekana.

English Sentences: For I give you good doctrine, forsake ye not my law.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani intteyyo lo77o timirttiyaa immiyo gishshau, ta timirttiyaa yeggoppite.

English Sentences: For I was my father's son, tender and only beloved in the sight of my mother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ta huuphenkka ta aawaassi na7a; ta aayeessikka a siiqiyo mexi issi na7a.

English Sentences: He taught me also, and said unto me, Let thine heart retain my words: keep my commandments, and live.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta aawai tana tamaarissiiddi, hagaadan yaagiis; "Taani odiyoogee neeyyo gelo; ta azazuwaa naaga; yaatikko, neeni paxa de7ana.

English Sentences: Get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaanne akeekaa demmanau minna; taani neeyyo odidobaa dogoppa; ta qaalaappe kiyoppa.

English Sentences: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee: love her, and she shall keep thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaayyo zokkuwaa zaaroppa; aissi giikko, i nena ashshana; a siiqa; siiqikko i nena naagana.

English Sentences: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettai ubbaappe aadhdhiyo gishshau, aadhdhida eratettaa demma. Akeekai ne aquwaa ubbaa wurssi ekkikkokka a demma.

English Sentences: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee: she shall bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni a bonchcha; ikka nena xoqqu xoqqu oottana; neeni a oiqqikko, i nena bonchchana.

English Sentences: She shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ne huuphiyan sabaa akiliiliyaa wottana; bonchcho kallachchaakka immana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; and the years of thy life shall be many.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, siya; taani giyoogaakka ekka; ne bareekka aduqqana.

English Sentences: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right paths.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani nena aadhdhida eratettaa ogiyaa kaalettana; suure loossuwaarakka efaana.

English Sentences: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni hemettiyo wode, ne hemettiyoosan xubbiyaabi de7enna; woxxikkokka xubettakka.

English Sentences: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she is thy life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tamaaridoogaa hassaya; timirttee neeyyo de7o gidido gishshau, loitta naaga; yeddoppa.

English Sentences: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nagaranchchatu ogiyaa yedhdhoppa; iita asatu ogiyankka hemettoppa;

English Sentences: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.
Wolaitta Sentences: appe haakka; an hemettoppa; appe guyye simma; yaatada ne ogiyan ba.

English Sentences: For they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, eti iitabaa oottana gakkanaashin, xiskkanau danddayokkona; eti asa xubbennan eta xiskkoi efeenna.

English Sentences: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti nagaraa oittadan moosona; sugettaa oosuwaakka ushshadan uyoosona.

English Sentences: But the path of the just is as the shining light, that shineth more and more unto the perfect day.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotu ogee gallassai seetana gakkanaashin, gujji gujji poo7iya maallado xalqqiyaa mala.

English Sentences: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin nagaranchchatu ogee sakkanaa xumaa mala; eti aibin xubettiyaakkokka erokkona.

English Sentences: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, taani yootiyoogaa siya; taani odiyoogaakka loittada ezgga.

English Sentences: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani odidobati ne baazzaappe deshoppona; eta ne wozanan wotta.

English Sentences: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, etabai geliyo asau ubbau eti de7uwaa immoosona; eta bollaukka payyatettaa immoosona.

English Sentences: Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbabaappekka ne wozanaa minttada naaga; aissi giikko, de7oi appe pulttees.

English Sentences: Put away from thee a froward mouth, and perverse lips put far from thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne doonaappe gene haasayaa digga; wordduwaa haasayiyaageetu achchappekka kichcha.

English Sentences: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sitti gaada sinttau xeella; ne aifee ne sinttan de7iyaabaa tishshi oottidi xeello.

English Sentences: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne gediyaassi ogiyaa salallissa; suure oge xalaalan hemetta.

English Sentences: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remove thy foot from evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suure ogiyaappe ushachchi haddirssi baqqoppa; ne tohoi iitasaa beennaadan naaga.

English Sentences: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, ta aadhdhida eratettaa ezgga; ne haittaa ta akeekaakko yegga.

English Sentences: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatikko, adussa qofai neessi de7ana; ne haasayaikka ne eratettaa qonccissana.

English Sentences: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaaramuxa maccaasee inxxarssaappe eessaa ililoi xokkees; i haasayai zaitiyaappekka aadhdhi looxigees.

English Sentences: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin a wurssettan - godare uttaadan cammausu; naa77u baggan qanxxiya mashshadan qara;

English Sentences: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.
Wolaitta Sentences: i tohoti haiquwaakko duge boosona; i hemetai sitti oottidi, duufuwau efees.

English Sentences: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.
Wolaitta Sentences: A de7uwaa ogiyaa qoppukku; i ogeti geella; shin geella gidiyoogaakka a erukku.

English Sentences: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, ha77ikka taani odiyoogaa siya; taani giyoogaappe kiyoppa.

English Sentences: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaaramuxa maccaasee heeri booppa; i keettaa penggiyaakko shiiqoppa.

English Sentences: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegee xayikko, neeni ne bonchchuwaa haratuyyo aattada immana. Neeni ne yelagatettan meqetti bainna asatu kushiyan haiqqana.

English Sentences: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne aquwaa allaga asati ekkana. Ne daafurada shiishshidobai haraassa gidana.

English Sentences: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
Wolaitta Sentences: Wurssettan ne ashoinne ne asatettai gilqqin, neeni oolana.

English Sentences: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi hagaadan yaagana; "Taani timirttiyaa aissi ixxidanaashsha! Ta wozanaikka seeraa aissi karideeshsha!

English Sentences: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani tana tamaarissiyaageeti odidobaa ekkabeikke; tana zoriyaageetu zoriyaakka ezggabeikke.

English Sentences: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, taani deree shiiqido yaa7an, akeekennan kauyyanau de7ais" yaagana.

English Sentences: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ne pulttuwaappe haattaa uya; ne keettaayee xalaalaa siiqa.

English Sentences: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne pulttuwaa dabaaban, ne ollaa haattaakka dembban aissi gussai?

English Sentences: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers' with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta neeni ne xalaalau buzotta; hara allaga uraara koxxoppa.

English Sentences: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne pulttoi neeyyo anjjetto; yelagatettan neeni ekkido ne maccaaseera ufaitta.

English Sentences: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77iya gaareedaaninne ufaissiya genesseedan, i xanttai ubba wodekka nena alo; ubbatoo i siiqoi nena omooddo.

English Sentences: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, shaaramuxa maccaasiyaa nena aibissi omooddai? Hara asa machchiyo aibissi qoommai?

English Sentences: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, asi oottiyoobaa ubbaa GODAI be7ees; i hemettiyo loosso ubbaa xeellees.

English Sentences: His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nagaranchchaa i oottido nagarai oiqqees. A nagaraa gitee a qachchees.

English Sentences: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ba eeyyatettan haliis; ba huuphiyaa naagibeenna gishshau haiqqiis.

English Sentences: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, neeni miishsha tal77ida ne shooruwaassi waase gelidabaa gidikko, neeni erenna uraassi ne kushiyaa baqqada geppidabaa gidikko,

English Sentences: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: neeni geppido gefaa gitiyan gelidabaa gidikko, ne doonaappe kiyida qaalan oiqettidabaa gidikko,

English Sentences: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.
Wolaitta Sentences: simmi neeni ne shooruwaa kushiyan geladasa. Hegaa gishshau, ta na7au, hegaappe kiyanau koyikko, elle ne shooruwaa soo ba; baada waasetettaa i ne bollappe wottana mala, auddashada a woossa.

English Sentences: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hagaa oottennan de7aidda xiskkoppa; shemppuwaakka shemppoppa.

English Sentences: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHankkaappe genessiyaa kessa ekkiyoogaadan, gitiyaappe kafiyaa attiyoogaadan, ne huuphiyaa ashsha.

English Sentences: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:
Wolaitta Sentences: Inttenoo azallatoo, qaacotukko biite; biidi etappe tamaarite. Yaatidi aadhdhida eranchcha gidite.

English Sentences: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,
Wolaitta Sentences: Qaacota ootissanau azaziyaabi, halaqi woikko eta haariyaabi baawa;

English Sentences: Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin banttau maanabaa bone minjjoosona; kattaa cakkiyo wodekka banttau koshshiya kattaa shiishshoosona.

English Sentences: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
Wolaitta Sentences: Nenoo azallau, neeni aude gakkanaashin xiskkuutee? Ne xiskkuwaappekka aude dendduutee?

English Sentences: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni qassikka guuttaa zin77aasa; guuttaa xiskkaasa; kushiyaa shiishsha ekkada, guuttaa shemppaasa.

English Sentences: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatiyo wode hiyyeesatettai panggaadan, pacai ola miishshaa oiqqida asadan, ne bolli yaana.

English Sentences: A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asinne hanttaara asi, yuuyi yuuyidi wordduwaa odees;

English Sentences: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;
Wolaitta Sentences: i ba aifiyan qim77otees; ba tohuwan bessees; ba biradhdhiyan malaatees.

English Sentences: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.
Wolaitta Sentences: A uluwan geellatettai de7ees; i iitabaa qoppees; ubbatookka i ooshshaa medhdhees.

English Sentences: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gaasuwan bashshai akeekennan a bolli yaana; i hassayennan meqqana; meqqidikka paxenna.

English Sentences: These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI ixxiyo usuppun yohoti de7oosona; i shenetiyo yohoti ubba laappuna:

English Sentences: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,
Wolaitta Sentences: karidi xeelliya aifiyaa, worddotiya inxxarssaa, ashkke asata woriya kushiyaa,

English Sentences: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,
Wolaitta Sentences: iitabaa maqqiya wozanaa, iitabaakko eesotidi woxxiya tohuwaa,

English Sentences: A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.
Wolaitta Sentences: wordduwaa bolli wordduwaa gujji gujjidi odiya worddo markkaa, ishatu giddon ooshshaa medhdhiya asa.

English Sentences: My son, keep thy father's commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, ne aawaa azazuwaa pola; ne aayyiyaa nena tamaarissidoogaakka aggoppa;

English Sentences: Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.
Wolaitta Sentences: eta ubbatoo ne wozanan oiqqa; ne qooriyankka qachcha.

English Sentences: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni hemettiyo wode, eti nena kaalettana; neeni zin77iyo wode, eti nena naagana; neeni beegottiyo wodekka, eti nena zorana.

English Sentences: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, ha azazoti xomppe; timirttetikka poo7o; qassi seeraikka de7uwaakko efiya oge.

English Sentences: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha azazotinne ha timirtteti iita maccaarippenne azina machchi cimo inxxarssaappe nena naagana.

English Sentences: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.
Wolaitta Sentences: I puulaa ne wozanan qaaqqatoppa; i qim77otankka omoodettoppa.

English Sentences: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi attumaasi issi oittaa immidi, shaaramuxa maaccaasa demmanau danddayees; shin azina machcho laggettiyoogee nena worissana.

English Sentences: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi asi tamaa idimmin, a maayoi meetettennan attanau danddayii?

English Sentences: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi asi tamaa bonqquwaa yedhdhi hemettin, a tohoi xuugettennan attanee?

English Sentences: So he that goeth in to his neighbour's wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asa machcho laggettiya urai hegaakka mala; o bochchiya ubbai qaxxayettennan attenna.

English Sentences: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;
Wolaitta Sentences: Kaisoi namisettidi, baayyo maanau wuuqqikko, asai a karenna.

English Sentences: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i oiqettidaba gidikko, laappun kushe qanxxana; ba son de7iya miishsha ubbaakka immana.

English Sentences: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin maccaasaara shaaramuxiya asi wozana paca; he urai ba shemppuwaa bashshees.

English Sentences: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Deshettiyoogeenne kauyyiyoogee a gakkida saama. A yeellai appe mulekka qucettenna.

English Sentences: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, maccaasee azinai mishettidi, hanqquwaa suullana; suullidi ba haluwaa kessiyo wode, au qarettenna.

English Sentences: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.
Wolaitta Sentences: I aiba afilaamakka ekkenna; ai keena imoikka a hanqquwaa doshissenna.

English Sentences: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, ta qaalaa naaga; ta azazuwaakka baloppa.

English Sentences: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeyyo paxa de7anau ta azaziyoogaa ootta; ta timirttiyaakka ne aifiyaa buluwaadan naaga.

English Sentences: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the table of thine heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hassayissiyaabaadan eta ne biradhdhetun qachcha; ne wozanankka xaafa.

English Sentences: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister; and call understanding thy kinswoman:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaa ne michchidan, akeekaakka ne mata dabbodan xeella.

English Sentences: That they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger which flattereth with her words.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti nena shaaramuxiya maccaaseeppenne ba qaalan cimmiya azina machchippe naagana.

English Sentences: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement,
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi gallassi taani ta keettaa maskkootiyaara kare xeellaas;

English Sentences: And beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,
Wolaitta Sentences: xeellada wozanaa kunttibeenna wodalla naata be7aas. Eta giddoppe issoi keehi eeyya.

English Sentences: Passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,
Wolaitta Sentences: He wodallai ogiyaara biidi, issi shaaramuxa maccaasee keettaa mataara kanttiis; i soo efiya ogiyaakko pinnidi, i keettaa heeran hemettees.

English Sentences: In the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night:
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode sa7ai qammanau lankkilankkees.

English Sentences: And, behold, there met him a woman with the attire of an harlot, and subtil of heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, maccaasiyaa a demmaasu. A shaaramuxa gidiyoogaa i maayoi erissees. A asaa cimmanau halchchada kiyaasu.

English Sentences: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet abide not in her house:
Wolaitta Sentences: A xalanne yeelli bainna maccaasa; son woppu gaada uttukku.

English Sentences: Now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every corner.)
Wolaitta Sentences: A issitoo ogiyan, issitoo giyan, dabaaba ubban eqqada naagausu.

English Sentences: So she caught him, and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,
Wolaitta Sentences: A he na7aa qoommada yeraasu; a a aifiyaa tishshi ootta xeellaidda hagaadan yaagaasu;

English Sentences: I have peace offerings with me; this day have I payed my vows.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani ta yarshshuwaa yarshshada, ta shiiquwaa ha77i gatta simmais.

English Sentences: Therefore came I forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatada nena xomoosanau kiyaas; nena keehi koyaas; ha77i simmi demmaas.

English Sentences: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Gibxxeppe yiida, alleequwaara de7iya anssollaakka ta hiixan yeggaas.

English Sentences: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani karbbiyaa, almmuniyaanne qarafaa geetettiya sawotuppe kessido shittuwaa ta hiixan caccafaas.

English Sentences: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us solace ourselves with loves.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haaya; ane wonttana gakkanaashin siiquwaa aloos; qoomettidikka ufaittoos;

English Sentences: For the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey:
Wolaitta Sentences: aissi giikko, ta keettaawai son de7enna; haahosaa manddara biis.

English Sentences: He hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day appointed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biiddi miishshaa qarcciitaa kuntti ekkidi biido gishshau, aginai goobanan uttennan soo simmenna" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagada ba mal77o haasayan a sheleeshshaasu; ba liiqo inxxarssan cimmaasu.

English Sentences: He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, sohuwaarakka i o kaallidi, bi aggiis. Boorai shukkiyoosaa laagettiyoogaadan, gaarai eesotidi piriyan geliyoogaadan,

English Sentences: Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.
Wolaitta Sentences: gelin zubbee a wozanaa caddiyoogaadan haniis. Gitiyaa giddo gelida kafo milatiis. Hagee ubbai au a shemppuwaa maanau haniyoogaa eribeenna.

English Sentences: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, ane ha77i siya; ta doonaappe kiyiya qaalaakka ezgga.

English Sentences: Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne qofai he maccaaseera booppo; i ogiyan gelada xayoppa.

English Sentences: For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.
Wolaitta Sentences: A caddada olidoogeeti unddenna; a woridoogeetikka keehi daro.

English Sentences: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
Wolaitta Sentences: I soi duufuwaakko efiya badaasa oge; he ogee duge haiquwaa geessuwau kaalettees.

English Sentences: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?
Wolaitta Sentences: Siyite! Aadhdhida eratettiyaa xeesausu; akeekaikka ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi alaahees.

English Sentences: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ogiyaa doonan de7iya keratu bollinne ogeti danttettiyoosan a eqqausu;

English Sentences: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.
Wolaitta Sentences: dirssaa penggiyaa lanqqen, katamaa geliyo penggen eqqada, ba qaalaa xoqqu oottada, hagaadan yaagausu;

English Sentences: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Inttenoo asatoo, taani inttena xeesais; taani asa ubbaa xeesais.

English Sentences: O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: Inttenoo akeekai paccidoogeetoo, hayyuwaa demmanau tamaarite. Inttenoo eeyyatoo, akeekaa demmite.

English Sentences: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani daro lo77obaa odiyo gishshau siyite; taani odiyoobai ubbai suurebaa.

English Sentences: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani tumaa odais; worddobaa taani ixxais.

English Sentences: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani haasayiyoobai ubbai tuma; geella woikko mirqqetta gidenna.

English Sentences: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeeki de7iyo urau ta haasayai likke; erai de7iyoogeetau ta haasayai qoncce.

English Sentences: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Biraa aggidi, ta zoriyaa doorite; muruta worqqaakka aggidi, eratettaa doorite.

English Sentences: For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko taani, aadhdhida eratettiyaa, inqquwaa giyo daro al77o shuchchaappekka aadhdhais; neeni amottiyoobai ubbaikka tanaara laggetanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taassi, aadhdhida eratetteessi akeekai de7ees; eratettaikka adussa qofaikka tanaara issippe de7oosona.

English Sentences: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.
Wolaitta Sentences: Godaassi yayyiyoogee iitatettaa ixxiyoogaa; taani otoruwaanne ayyuwaa ixxais; iitasaa efiya ogiyaanne worddo haasayaa dosikke.

English Sentences: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zoreenne lo77o erai taageeta; akeekainne wolqqainne taassi de7oosona.

English Sentences: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoti tanan kawotoosona; qassi haariyaageeti suure higgiyaa tanan kessoosona.

English Sentences: By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Halaqati taani maaddin, deriyaa haaroosona; sa7an dere haariya gita asata ubbaakka taani maaddais.

English Sentences: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani tana siiqiyaageeta siiqais; tana minttidi koyiyaageetikka demmana.

English Sentences: Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Duretettainne bonchchoi tanaara de7oosona; wurenna aqoinne injjee ta mataana.

English Sentences: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte taappe demmiyo go77ai muruta worqqaappenne seerissi kessido biraappe aadhdhees.

English Sentences: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani xillotettaa ogiyan hemettais; suure pirddaa loossuwaara kanttais.

English Sentences: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana siiqiyaageetau taani aquwaa immana; eta keettaakka taani kunttana.

English Sentences: The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.
Wolaitta Sentences: "GODAI tana ba ooso ubbaappe koiro medhdhiis; benippekka a oosuwau doomettai tana.

English Sentences: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.
Wolaitta Sentences: Beni wode, biittai sa7ai merettanaappe kase taani sunttettaas.

English Sentences: When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gita abbati bainna wode, haattaa pulttoti xuuqqenna wode, he wode taani yelettaas.

English Sentences: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:
Wolaitta Sentences: Deretinne kerati bantta sohuwan merettanaappe kase taani yelettaas.

English Sentences: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI sa7aanne sa7an de7iya gadeta ubbaa medhdhanaappe kase, woikko issi kophphe gidiya koiro sophphee oosettanaappe kase taani yelettaas.

English Sentences: When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:
Wolaitta Sentences: "GODAI salota miccido wodenne gita abbatuppe bollaara salo gufanttuwaa giigissido wode, taani yan de7ais.

English Sentences: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI shaarata bollan wottido wode, gita abbaa pulttota xuussido wode,

English Sentences: When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:
Wolaitta Sentences: abbaa haattati banttau imettida zawaappe pinnidi, bollau aadhdhennaadan, i eta azazido wode, sa7aa baasuwaa i baasido wode, taani yan de7ais.

English Sentences: Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode taani a matan waanna oosanchcha; ubba gallassi taani a ufaissais; taukka a sinttan ufaittais.

English Sentences: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.
Wolaitta Sentences: I medhdhidobai ubbai, sa7aikka asaa naatikka tana ufaissoosona.

English Sentences: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ha77ikka simmi ta naatoo, siyite; taani yootiyoogaadan oottiyaageeti anjjettidaageeta.

English Sentences: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta timirttiyaa siyite; siyidi aadhdhida eranchcha gidite; siyidobaa shenehoo gooppite.

English Sentences: Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani yootiyoogaa siyiya urai, hachchi hachchi ta penggen beettiya urai, ta soo geliyoosankka naagiya urai anjjettidaagaa.

English Sentences: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana demmiyaagee de7uwaa demmees; GODAAPPE i sabaa demmees.

English Sentences: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin tana demmennan aggiya urai bana qohees; tana ixxiya ubbati, haiquwaa siiqoosona" yaagausu.

English Sentences: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettiyaa ba keettaa keexxausu; keexxaidda he keettau laappun tuussata essaasu.

English Sentences: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ba giigissiyo gibiraayyo modhdho mehiyaa shukkaasu; woiniyaa eessaakka agada giigissaasu. Giigissada maaddaa sinttau aattaasu.

English Sentences: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatada asaa xeesanau ba ashkkarata kiittaasu. Kiittin ashkkarati katamaassi xoqqa sohuwan eqqidi,

English Sentences: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
Wolaitta Sentences: "Inttenoo, eri paccidoogeetoo hagaa gelite!" yaagidosona. Eeyyatakka a hagaadan yaagaasu;

English Sentences: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Haa yiite; yiidi ta qumaa miite; taani agido woiniyaa eessaakka uyite!

English Sentences: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyyatettaa aggidi, shemppoora paxa de7ite; akeekaa ogiyan hemettite" yaagausu.

English Sentences: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qilliicciya uraa seeriya asi bau cashshaa ekkees; iita uraa zoriyaageekka bau qohettees.

English Sentences: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qilliicciya uraa zoroppa; zorikko i nena ixxana. Aadhdhida eranchcha uraa zora; zorikko i nena siiqana.

English Sentences: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchcha uraa tamaarissa; yaatikko, i kaseegaappekka aadhdhida eranchcha gidana. Xillo uraakka tamaarissa; yaatikko i eraa gujjana.

English Sentences: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaassi doomettai GODAASSI yayyiyoogaa; Geeshsha GODAA eriyoogee akeekiyoogaa.

English Sentences: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tanan aadhdhida eratettan laittai darana; ne bareekka aduqqana.

English Sentences: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni aadhdhida eranchcha gidikko, ne huuphiyau go7ettaasa. Neeni qilliicciyaagaa gidikkokka, ne huuphiyau qohettaasa.

English Sentences: A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi Eeyyo giyo maccaasiyaa wocama darausu; iyyo yeelli baawa; a ainne erukku.

English Sentences: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,
Wolaitta Sentences: A ba karen, woikko katamaassi xoqqa sohuwan oidiyan uttausu.

English Sentences: To call passengers who go right on their ways:
Wolaitta Sentences: Uttada suure bantta ogiyaa oiqqidi biya asaa xeesausu; xeesada,

English Sentences: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
Wolaitta Sentences: "Inttenoo, eri paccidoogeetoo, taakko haa yiite" yaagausu. Akeeki bainnaagaakka,

English Sentences: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Wuuqqidi uyiyo haattai mal77ees; geeman miyo qumaikka pashkkissees" yaagausu.

English Sentences: But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin haiqqida asai yan de7iyoogaa, i imattatikka hirkkin, duufo giddon de7iyoogaa i erenna.

English Sentences: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hageeti Solomona leemisota. Aadhdhida eranchcha na7ai ba aawaa ufaissees; shin eeyya na7ai ba aayyiyo azzanissees.

English Sentences: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nagaran demmido miishshai go77enna; shin xillotettai haiquwaappe ashshees.

English Sentences: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI xillota namisissenna; shin nagaranchchatu amuwaa polissenna.

English Sentences: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azallatettai hiyyeesissees; shin minnidi oottiyoogee dureyees.

English Sentences: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchcha urai kattaa boniyan shiishshees; shin kattaa cakkiyo wode xiskkiya urai kauyyees.

English Sentences: Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asai anjjettees; shin nagaranchchaa doonai makkalaa genttees.

English Sentences: The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilluwaa sunttai anjjuwan xeesettiiddi, de7i aggees; shin nagaranchchatu sunttai sohuwaara dogettees.

English Sentences: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchati azazidobaa oottoosona; shin eeyyatettan coo biddiyaageeti bashshau boosona.

English Sentences: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suure asi saro de7ees; shin geella urai ba mooruwan ohettees.

English Sentences: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.
Wolaitta Sentences: Geniiddi qim77otiya uri meto kessees; shin yayyennan seeriya uri sarotettaa medhdhees.

English Sentences: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilluwaa haasayai de7uwaa pultto; shin nagaranchchaa haasayai makkalaa genttees.

English Sentences: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ixoi palamaa denttettees; shin siiqoi mooruwaa ubbaa qoodenna.

English Sentences: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozannaama asai aadhdhida eran haasayees; shin eeyya urai xam77an shocettees.

English Sentences: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchati eraa dagayoosona; shin eeyya haasayaa haasayiya urai bana bashshees.

English Sentences: The rich man's wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Duriyaa miishshai direttida katamaadan, ba godaa naagees; shin hiyyeesatettai hiyyeesaa xaissees.

English Sentences: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo uraa a lo77o oosoi de7uwau kaalettees; shin iita uraa wurssettai qixaate.

English Sentences: He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Seerin eeniya urai de7uwaa ogiyan hemettees; shin seerin ixxiya urai balees.

English Sentences: He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ixxiiddi ba ixxiyoogaa erissenna urai worddanchcha; zigirssaa laaliya uraikka eeyya.

English Sentences: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro haasayaa giddon nagari xayenna; shin ba doonaa shiishshi ekkiya uri aadhdhida eranchcha.

English Sentences: The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilluwaa inxxarssai tigettida geeshsha biraa mala; shin iita uraa qofau gatee guutta.

English Sentences: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo uraa haasayai daro asaa go77ees; shin eeyyati bantta wozanaa pacan haiqqoosona.

English Sentences: The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAA anjjoi dure kessees; i he duretettan meto walakkenna.

English Sentences: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya urau iitabaa oottiyoogee kaassa mala; shin wozannaama urai aadhdhida eratettan ufaittees.

English Sentences: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita urai hirggidobai a bolli gakkana; shin xilloi amottidobai imettana.

English Sentences: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gotee denddidi aadhdhiichchiyo wode, nagaranchchati beettokkona; shin xilloti merinau minnidi de7ana.

English Sentences: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Caalai achchaa zil77issiyoogaadaaninne cuwai aifiyaa poogiyoogaadan, azalla uraa kiittiyoogee yiilloyees.

English Sentences: The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAASSI yayyiyoogee bariyaa adussees; shin nagaranchcha uraa baree qaammees.

English Sentences: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo urai sinttaara ufaissai yaana giidi naagees; shin iita urai sinttaara yaana giidi naagiyoobi aibinne baawa.

English Sentences: The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAA ogee xillotussi baqati attiyo soho; shin iitaa oottiyaageetassi bashsha.

English Sentences: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilloti mulekka xoqolettokkona; shin iitati biittaa bolli de7okkona.

English Sentences: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asai aadhdhida eratettaa haasayees; shin geellabaa haasayiya inxxarssai qanxxettana.

English Sentences: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asai bessiya haasayaa erees; shin iita asai geellaa haasayees.

English Sentences: A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is his delight.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI worddo meezaanaa ixxees; shin likke meezaanan ufaittees.

English Sentences: When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Otoroi yiyo wode kaushshatettai yees; shin ashkketettaara aadhdhida eratettai yees.

English Sentences: The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillota eta suuretettai kaalettees; shin ammanettennaageeta eta geellatettai xaissees.

English Sentences: Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hanqquwaa gallassi duretettai go77enna; shin xillotettai haiquwaappe ashshees.

English Sentences: The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Boree bainna uraa ogiyaa a xillotettai sittissees; shin iita urai ba iitatettan kunddees.

English Sentences: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suureta eta xillotettai ashshees; shin ammanettennaageeta eta amoi pire gididi oiqqana.

English Sentences: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi haiqqiyo wode, i naagiyo ufaissaikka aara issippe haiqqees; i ba wolqqan ceeqettiyoobai ubbikka xayees.

English Sentences: The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilloi metuwaappe attees; a gishshaa iitaa bolli metoi yees.

English Sentences: An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa kaddida asi ba doonan asa xaissees; shin xilloti eran kessi ekkoosona.

English Sentences: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilloti bonchchettiyo wode, katamai ufaittees; qassi iitati haiqqiyo wode, hashshu gees.

English Sentences: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotu anjjuwaa gaasuwan katamai diccees; shin iita uraa haasayai katamaa xaissees.

English Sentences: He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba shooruwaa kariya urau wozani baawa; shin akeekanchcha uri co77u gees.

English Sentences: A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zigirssanchcha asi xuuraa laalees; shin ammanettiya asi xuuraa genttees.

English Sentences: Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kaalettiyaabi xayikko, kawotettai kunddees; shin daro zoriyaageeti de7ikko, saroi de7ees.

English Sentences: He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.
Wolaitta Sentences: Erenna urau waase gidiya asi tumuppe metootana; hegaappe waase gidennan ixxiyoogee lo77o.

English Sentences: A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ulo keha maccaasiyaa bonchchettausu; shin meqettaa iita asai duretetta xalaalaa duretees.

English Sentences: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.
Wolaitta Sentences: Keha asi baassi lo77obaa oottees; shin meqettaa iita asi bana qohees.

English Sentences: The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi demmiyo miishshai cimo; shin xillotettaa zeriya uri tumu woituwaa cakkana.

English Sentences: As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotettan minnidi de7iya uri paxa de7ana; shin iitatettaa kaalliya uri haiqqana.

English Sentences: They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the LORD: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI iita qofai de7iyo asata ixxees; shin suure hemettiyaageetan ufaittees.

English Sentences: Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi qaxxayettanaagee attenna; shin xillotu zaree attana.

English Sentences: As a jewel of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.
Wolaitta Sentences: Adussa qofi bainna puulanchcha maccaasee puulai gudunttaa siiriyan aattido worqqaa alleequwaa mala.

English Sentences: The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotu amuwaa poloi lo77o xalaala; shin iitatu amuwaa poloi hanqqo xalaala.

English Sentences: There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi issi asati bantta miishshaa asau coo kehoosona; shin eta aqoi yaa darees. Hara asati qassi bantta miishshau pala uuzettoosona; shin eta aqoi haa paccees.

English Sentences: The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
Wolaitta Sentences: Keha asi duretana; harata maaddiya asi maadettana.

English Sentences: He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kattai al77in baizzanau minjjiya uraa asai qanggees. SHin ba kattaa asai koyiyo wode baizziya uraa anjjees.

English Sentences: He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77obaa minttidi koyiya uri ufaissaa demmees; shin iitabaa koyiya uraa iitabai demmees.

English Sentences: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall; but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba duretettan ammanettiya asi kunddana; shin xilloti balggo mittaadan daayana.

English Sentences: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba so asaa bolli cabbo denttiya uri go7ettanabi aibinne baawa. Eeyyatikka aadhdhida eranchchatuyyo ashkkara gidana.

English Sentences: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asi de7o aifiyaa aifiya mitta mala; shemppo ashshiyaageeti aadhdhida eranchcha.

English Sentences: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilloti sa7an bantta oosuwaa waagaa ekkiyaabaa gidikko, iitatinne nagaranchchati bantta oosuwaassi ekkana waagai waani daranddeeshsha!

English Sentences: Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is brutish.
Wolaitta Sentences: Seeriyoogaa dosiya uri eratettaa dosees; shin seeraa ixxiya uri damma.

English Sentences: A good man obtaineth favour of the LORD: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77o asi GODAAPPE sabaa demmees; shin GODAI genanchchata pirddees.

English Sentences: A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asa iitatettai minttidi essenna; shin xillotu xaphoi qaaxxenna.

English Sentences: A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozannaama maccaasiyaa ba keettaawau kallachcha mala; shin ba keettaawaa kaushshiya maccaasiyaa a meqettaa miya ajaajje mala.

English Sentences: The thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotu qofai suure; shin iitatu zoree cimo.

English Sentences: The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitatu haasayai asa woranaassa; shin xillotu haasayai eta ashshees.

English Sentences: The wicked are overthrown, and are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asati kunddana; etau zerettikka attenna; shin xillotu zerettai minnidi de7ana.

English Sentences: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi ba aadhdhida eratettaa keenaa galatettees; shin geella qofai de7iyo asi karettees.

English Sentences: He that is despised, and hath a servant, is better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dure asa milatidi, metuwan de7iya asaappe coo asa milatidi, oottiiddi ba de7uwaa sugiya asi keha.

English Sentences: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asi ba mehiyaassi qarettees; shin iita asa kehatettau meqetti baawa.

English Sentences: He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba biittaa mintti oottiya urai kattaa kallees; shin pattennabaa yedettiya uri akeekai paccidoogaa.

English Sentences: The wicked desireth the net of evil men: but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitati nagaranchcha asatu omooduwaa ekkanau amottoosona; shin xillotu xaphoi daayidi de7ana.

English Sentences: The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asa a doonaappe kiyida haasayai pire gididi oiqqees; shin xilloi metuwaappe kessi ekkees.

English Sentences: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth: and the recompence of a man's hands shall be rendered unto him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi ba doonaappe kiyiya qaalan lo77obaa kallees; ba oottido oosuwaa waagaakka ekkees.

English Sentences: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asi biyo buussai au a huuphen likke milatees; shin aadhdhida eranchcha asi zoriyaa siyees.

English Sentences: A fool's wrath is presently known: but a prudent man covereth shame.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya uraa hanqqoi sohuwaara erettees; shin cincca asi cashshaa wudenna.

English Sentences: He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tumaa haasayiya asi suurebaa yootees; shin worddo markkai wordduwaa yootees.

English Sentences: There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise is health.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeekennan haasayiyo haasayai cuphedan caddees; shin aadhdhida eranchchaa inxxarssai pattees.

English Sentences: The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Worddo haasayi guutta wodiyaassa; shin tuma haasayi merinau de7ana.

English Sentences: Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counsellors of peace is joy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitaa qoppiyaageetu wozanan genee de7ees; shin sarobaa zorettiyaageetu wozanan ufaissai kumees.

English Sentences: There shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillota metoi gakkenna; shin iitatussi metoppe attin, harabi de7enna.

English Sentences: Lying lips are abomination to the LORD: but they that deal truly are his delight.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI worddanchchata ixxees; shin tumanchcha asatun i ufaittees.

English Sentences: A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Cincca asi ba eraa qottees; shin eeyyati bantta eeyyatettaa yootoosona.

English Sentences: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.
Wolaitta Sentences: Minnidi oottiya uri deriyaa haarees; shin azallai haarettees.

English Sentences: Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hirggiyoogee asa ufaissaa diggees; shin shonggaara de7iya haasayai a ufaissees.

English Sentences: The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asi ba shooruwaa zoridi, suure ogiyaa kaalettees; shin iitatu ogee tumaappe haassees.

English Sentences: The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azalla asi shankkatidi ehiido ashuwaa kattenna; shin asau aqoi minnidi oottiyoogaa.

English Sentences: In the way of righteousness is life: and in the pathway thereof there is no death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotettaa ogiyan de7oi de7ees; he ogiyan haiqoi baawa.

English Sentences: A wise son heareth his father's instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eranchcha na7ai ba aawaa seeraa siyees; shin qilliicciyaagee seeraa siyenna.

English Sentences: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi ba doonaappe kiyiya qaalan lo77obaa ekkees; shin ammanttennaageeti makkalabaa amottoosona.

English Sentences: He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba doonaa naagiya urai ba shemppuwaa naagees; shin eesuwan haasayiya urai bana xaissees.

English Sentences: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azallai amottees; amottikkonne aibanne demmenna; shin minnidi oottiyaageeti kallana.

English Sentences: A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asati worddo haasayaa ixxoosona. SHin iita asatu haasayai yeellayeesinne kaushshees.

English Sentences: Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suure de7uwaa de7iya uraa a xillotettai naagees; shin nagaranchchaa a nagarai onggees.

English Sentences: There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: there is that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bana dure milatissiya asi de7ees; shin au aibinne baawa; harai qassi bana hiyyeesa milatissiyaagee de7ees; shin au daro aqoi de7ees.

English Sentences: The ransom of a man's life are his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi ba miishshan ba shemppuwaa wozanau danddayees; shin hiyyeesaa yashissiyaabi baawa.

English Sentences: The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotussi ubbatoo poo7o; shin iitatu xomppee to7ana.

English Sentences: Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Otoroi ooshshaa yelees; shin zoriyaa ekkiyaageeti aadhdhida eranchcha.

English Sentences: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daafuri bainnan demmido miishshai eesuwan xayees; shin minni oottidi demmido aqoi, dari daridi bees.

English Sentences: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Koyiyoobai polettennan gam77iyoogee azzanissees; shin amottidobai polettiyoogee ufaissees.

English Sentences: Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zore kariya uri meton gelees; shin azazuwaa bonchchiya uri saruwan de7ana.

English Sentences: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchai immiyo timirttee de7o pultto; hegee asi haiquwaa piriyaappe kessi ekkanau maaddees.

English Sentences: Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors is hard.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeeki de7iyo uri bonchchettees; shin ammanettennan aggiyoogee bashshau efees.

English Sentences: Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open his folly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Cincca asai ubbai eran oottees; shin eeyyai ba eeyyatettaa qonccissees.

English Sentences: A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asati kiitettidi, meton geloosona; shin ammanttiya asati kiitettidi, sarotettaa ehoosona.

English Sentences: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.
Wolaitta Sentences: Seeraa ixxiya asi hiyyeeseesinne yeellatees; shin seerin siyiya urai bonchchettees.

English Sentences: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: Amottidobaa demmiyoogee keehi ufaissees; shin iitati iitaappe haakkanau koyokkona.

English Sentences: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchcha asatuura hemettiya asi aadhdhida eranchcha gidees; shin eeyya asatuura hemettiya asi metuwan gelees.

English Sentences: Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nagaranchchata iita qaadai kaallees; shin xilloti lo77o oosuwaa woituwaa ekkana.

English Sentences: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children's children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77o asi ba naatu naata laatissees; shin nagaranchchaa aqoi xilluwaassi dagattees.

English Sentences: Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesaa goshshai daro kattaa aifanau danddayees; shin suure pirddai paccidoogaa gaasuwan xayees.

English Sentences: He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qaixaariyan wadhdhanau qarettiya uri ba na7aa ixxees; shin ba na7aa siiqiya uri minnidi seerees.

English Sentences: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilloi a uloi kallana gakkanaassi mees; shin nagaranchchai namisettees.

English Sentences: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchcha maccaasiyaa ba keettaa keexxausu; shin eeyyiyaa ba keettaa ba kushiyan qolausu.

English Sentences: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suure hemettiya asi GODAASSI yayyees; shin ba ogiyaa geellayiya asi GODAA karees.

English Sentences: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyyaa haasayai a zokkuwaassi gatimaa ehees; shin aadhdhida eranchchatu inxxarssai eta naagees.

English Sentences: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
Wolaitta Sentences: Boorati bainnasan gootarai mela de7ees; shin neeyyo goyiyo wolqqaama boorati de7ikko, ne gootaran kattai kumees.

English Sentences: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ammanettiya markkai ubbaton tumaa odees; shin worddo markkai worddo xalaalaa haasayees.

English Sentences: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qilliicciyaagee aadhdhida eratettaa koyees; shin demmenna; akeekai de7iyo asi eratettaa demmanaagee a waayissenna.

English Sentences: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asappe haakka; aissi giikko, neeni a haasayaappe era demmakka.

English Sentences: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Cincca asi ba oottiyoogaa eriyo gishshau, aadhdhida eranchcha gidees; shin eeyya asi ainne erennankka eriyaabaa milatiyo gishshau eeyya gidees.

English Sentences: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyyati nagaraa oottidi, azzaniyoogaa gishshaa qilliiccoosona; shin suureti bantta nagarai atto geetettanau koyoosona.
