English Sentences: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba wozanaa azzanuwaa aawu erees; a ufaissaakka ooninne aara koxxenna.

English Sentences: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitatu keettai qolettana; shin suuretu keettai minnidi de7ana.

English Sentences: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asaassi likke milatiya ogee de7ees; shin bin, a wurssettai haiquwan kessi yeggees.

English Sentences: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Miichchankka wozanai azzani erees; ufaissaa wurssettaikka azzano gidanau danddayees.

English Sentences: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi ba iita oosuwaa waagaa ekkana; lo77o asikka ba lo77o oosuwaa waagaa ekkana.

English Sentences: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asi ubbabaa ammanees; shin cinccai akeekidi tanggees.

English Sentences: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchcha asi yayyees; iitaappekka haakkees; shin eeyyai banan ammanettidi otorettees.

English Sentences: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
Wolaitta Sentences: Elle hanqqettiya asati eeyya ooso oottoosona. SHin cinccati danddayanchcha.

English Sentences: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyyati bantta azallatettaa waagaa ekkoosona; shin cinccati eratettaa kallachchaadan goxxoosona.

English Sentences: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asati lo77o asatu sinttan hokkidi, maarotaa woossoosona. Nagaranchchatikka xillotu penggiyan hokkoosona.

English Sentences: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesai ba shooruwankka dosettenna; shin duretussi daro laggeti de7oosona.

English Sentences: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba shooruwaa kariya asi nagaraa oottees; shin hiyyeesaa maaddiyaageeti anjjettidaageeta.

English Sentences: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitabaa maqettiyaageeti baloosona gidokkonaa? SHin lo77obaa oottanau halchchiyaageeti tumatettaanne aggenna siiquwaa demmoosona.

English Sentences: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
Wolaitta Sentences: Minnidi oottidoban ubban go77ai de7ees; shin coo mela haasayai hiyeesatetta xalaalaa ehees.

English Sentences: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchatussi eta duretettai etau kallachcha; shin eeyyati bantta eeyyatettaa gujji gujjidi eeyyoosona.

English Sentences: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tumu markkai shemppuwaa ashshees; shin worddo markkai kashi erikke gees.

English Sentences: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAASSI yayyiya urau mino qatoi de7ees. I a naatussikka baqatidi attiyo soho gidana.

English Sentences: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAASSI yayyiyoogee de7oi kiyiyo pultto; hegaa gishshau, neeni haiquwaappe kessa ekkanau koyikko, GODAASSI yayya.

English Sentences: In the multitude of people is the king's honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwaa gitatettai i haariyo asaa coratettaana; shin haariyo asi xayikko, ikka pattenna.

English Sentences: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Danddayanchcha asaassi gita akeekai de7ees; shin elle hanqqettiya asi ba eeyyatettaa qonccissees.

English Sentences: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.
Wolaitta Sentences: Woppu giida wozanai bollaa payya wottees; shin qanaatee bollau ajaajje harggiyaa mala.

English Sentences: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesata toochchiya asi eta Medhdhidaagaa cayees; shin metootanchchatussi kehiya asi Xoossaa bonchchees.

English Sentences: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitati bantta iita oosuwan kunddana; shin xilloti bantta suuretettan naagettana.

English Sentences: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeekanchcha asaa wozanan aadhdhida eratettai kumiis; shin eeyyati aadhdhida eratettaabaa aibanne erokkona.

English Sentences: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotettai issi kawotettaa asaa xoqqu xoqqu oottees; shin nagarai ai asanne kaushshees.

English Sentences: The king's favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi eranchcha ashkkaran ufaittees; shin yeellayiya oosuwaa oottiya ashkkaraa hanqqettees.

English Sentences: A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
Wolaitta Sentences: Liiqo haasayai hanqquwaa zarbbissees; shin porddolla qaalai hanqquwaa denttettees.

English Sentences: The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchaa inxxarssai eraa puulayees; shin eeyyatu doonai eeyyatettaa xuuqqees.

English Sentences: The eyes of the LORD are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAA aifeti ubbasaa xeelloosona; iitaa oottiyaageetakka lo77uwaa oottiyaageetakka be7oosona.

English Sentences: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHonggaara de7iya lo77o haasayai de7o mittaa mala; shin geella haasayai ayyaanaa kinchchees.

English Sentences: A fool despiseth his father's instruction: but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asi ba aawaa seeraa karees; shin ba aawaa zoriyaa ekkiya asi eranchcha.

English Sentences: In the house of the righteous is much treasure: but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo uraa keettan daro miishshai de7ees; shin iitaassi geliya miishshai metuwaa ehees.

English Sentences: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge: but the heart of the foolish doeth not so.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchatu doonai eraa zerees; shin eeyyatu wozanai hegaa mala gidenna.

English Sentences: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but the prayer of the upright is his delight.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI iitatu yarshshuwaa shenetees; shin suuretu woosai a ufaissees.

English Sentences: The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the LORD: but he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI iita asatu hemetaa shenetees; shin xillotettaa kaalliyaageeta i siiqees.

English Sentences: Correction is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way: and he that hateth reproof shall die.
Wolaitta Sentences: Likke ogiyaa aggida asa iita boshai naagees; seeriyoogaa ixxiya asi haiqqees.

English Sentences: Hell and destruction are before the LORD: how much more then the hearts of the children of men?
Wolaitta Sentences: Harai attin, duufoikka bashshaikka GODAA sinttan qoncciyan beettoosona. Yaatin, asa wozanaa qofai waani appe geemmanee?

English Sentences: A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qilliicciya asi seeriyoogaa dosenna; aadhdhida eranchchatuppekka zore oichchenna.

English Sentences: A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozanai ufaittin, som77oi poo7ees; shin wozani azzanikko, he aawu siiddees.

English Sentences: The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeekiya wozanai de7iyo asi eratettaa koyees; shin eeyyati bantta eeyyatettan ufaittoosona.

English Sentences: All the days of the afflicted are evil: but he that is of a merry heart hath a continual feast.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesatu de7oi ubba gallassikka baaxe. SHin ufaittiya asati ubbatonkka bantta de7uwaa aloosona.

English Sentences: Better is little with the fear of the LORD than great treasure and trouble therewith.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooshshai de7iyo gita aquwaappe GODAA yashshatettai de7iyo guuttabai keha.

English Sentences: Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooshshai de7iyoosan modhdho ashuwaa maanaappe siiqoi de7iyoosan santtaa miyoogee keha.

English Sentences: A wrathful man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hanqqettiya asi ooshshaa kessees; shin hanqqettanau eesotenna asi ooshshaa irxxissees.

English Sentences: The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azalla uraassi metoi a oge ubban aguntta dirssa mala; shin suure uraa ogee badaasa.

English Sentences: A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish man despiseth his mother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eranchcha na7ai ba aawaa ufaissees; shin eeyya na7ai ba aayyiyo karees.

English Sentences: Folly is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding walketh uprightly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozani bainna asi ba eeyatettan ufaittees; shin wozannaama asi likkebaa oottees.

English Sentences: Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zoretai xayikko, halchchidobai halettees; daro zoriyaageeti de7iyoosan halchchidobai polettees.

English Sentences: A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth: and a word spoken in due season, how good is it!
Wolaitta Sentences: Oishettidobaassi likke zaaruwaa zaariyoogee he uraa ufaissees; haasayaa likke wodiyan haasayiyoogee aiba lo77obee!

English Sentences: The way of life is above to the wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchai bollau kaalettiya de7uwaa ogiyan hemetteesippe attin, duge duufuwau wottiya ogiyan hemettenna.

English Sentences: The LORD will destroy the house of the proud: but he will establish the border of the widow.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI otoranchchatu keettaa qolana; shin am77ee aquwaa naagees.

English Sentences: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD: but the words of the pure are pleasant words.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI iitatu qofaa shenetees; shin geeshsha qaalai a ufaissees.

English Sentences: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wordduwan woriyaa demmanau jaamiya asi ba so asaa bolli metuwaa ehees; shin mattaayiyaa ixxiya asi paxa de7ana.

English Sentences: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asi haasayanaappe kasetidi qoppees; shin iitatu inxxarssai palabaa pulttees.

English Sentences: The LORD is far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI iitatuppe haakkees; shin xillotu woosaa siyees.

English Sentences: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart: and a good report maketh the bones fat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Pashkkidi xeelliyo xeelai wozanaa ufaissees; mishiraachcho odoikka bollaa pattees.

English Sentences: The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.
Wolaitta Sentences: De7uwaa immiya zoriyaa siyiya asi aadhdhida eranchchatuura issippe de7ana.

English Sentences: He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul: but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Seeraa ixxiya asi bana qohees; shin seeraa ekkiya asi akeekaa demmees.

English Sentences: The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour is humility.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAASSI yayyiyoogee asa aadhdhida eratettaa tamaarissees; bonchchettana koyida asi koiro bana kaushshanau koshshees.

English Sentences: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, is from the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi ba wozanan halchchees; shin likke zaaroi GODAAPPE beettees.

English Sentences: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes; but the LORD weigheth the spirits.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi oottiyo ooso ubbai au likke milatees; shin GODAI koiro denddo qofaa yiggi xeellees.

English Sentences: Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne oottiyoobaa ubbaa hadaraa GODAAYYO imma; yaatikko, neeni halchchidobai polettana.

English Sentences: The LORD hath made all things for himself: yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI medhdhidobau ubbau a wurssettai de7ees; makkalanchchatu wurssettaikka bashshaa.

English Sentences: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI otorettiya ubbaa shenetees; eti qaxxayettennan attokkona.

English Sentences: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aggenna siiquwaaninne ammanettiyoogan nagarai atto geetettees; asi GODAAYYO yayyiyoogan iitabaa oottennan naagettees.

English Sentences: When a man's ways please the LORD, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asa hemeti GODAA ufaissiyaaba gidikko, he aawu ba morkketu addiniitaarakka saro de7anaadan, GODAI oottees.

English Sentences: Better is a little with righteousness than great revenues without right.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotettan beettiya guuttabai wordduwan demmiyo daro woriyaappe keha.

English Sentences: A man's heart deviseth his way: but the LORD directeth his steps.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi ba wozanan ba oottanabaa halchchees; shin halchchoi GODAI maaddin polettees.

English Sentences: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi Xoossaappe ekkido maatan pirddees; pirddiiddi i balenna.

English Sentences: A just weight and balance are the LORD's: all the weights of the bag are his work.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yiggiyo meezaanatinne makkiyo miishshati ammanttiyaageeta gidanaadan, GODAI koyees; baizziyooban ubban genee de7ennaadan koyees.

English Sentences: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoti mooro oosuwaa shenetoosona; aissi giikko, eta kawotaa araatai xillotettan eqqees.

English Sentences: Righteous lips are the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoti xillo inxxarssan ufaittoosona; tumaa haasayiyaageetakka dosoosona.

English Sentences: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwaa hanqqoi haiquwaa kiitanchchaa mala; shin aadhdhida eranchcha asi hanqquwaa irxxissanau auddashees.

English Sentences: In the light of the king's countenance is life; and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwaa som77oi pashkkikko, hegee simmi de7o. I nashshiyoogee badhdheesaa iraa ehiya shaaraa mala.

English Sentences: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaa demmiyoogee worqqaa demmiyoogaappe keha; akeekaa demmiyoogee biraa demmiyoogaappekka aadhdhees.

English Sentences: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suureti biyo ogee iiti de7iyoosaappe haahuwaara kanttissees; ba hemetaa naagiya uri ba shemppuwaa naagees.

English Sentences: Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.
Wolaitta Sentences: Otoruwaa geeduwaa bashshai kaallees; ayyuwaa geeduwaakka kunddettai kaallees.

English Sentences: Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ayyiyaageetuura zuppetidi, omooduwaa shaakki ekkanaappe ashkke gididi, hiyyeesidi de7iyoogee keha.

English Sentences: He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoso trusteth in the LORD, happy is he.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAA qaalaa loittidi ezggiya urau i oottiyoobai ubbai injjettana; GODAN ammanettiya uri anjjettidaagaa.

English Sentences: The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba qofan aadhdhida eranchcha gidida asi akeekanchcha geetettees; lo77o qaalai eratettaa gujjees.

English Sentences: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that hath it: but the instruction of fools is folly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Cincca urau eratettai de7o pultto mala; shin eeyyata seeriyoogee coo wode wurssiyoogaa.

English Sentences: The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchcha asi haasayanaappe kasetidi qoppees; qoppidi asi ekkiyo haasayaa haasayees.

English Sentences: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77o qaalai eessaa ililuwaadan mal77ees; bollaakka maaddeesinne pattees.

English Sentences: There is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asaassi suure milatiya ogee de7ees; shin wurssettan haiquwau gattees.

English Sentences: He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Namisainne metoi asi minnidi oottanaadan giddoosona.

English Sentences: An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips there is as a burning fire.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi iitabaa halchchees; a haasayaikka xuuggiya tamaa mala.

English Sentences: A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
Wolaitta Sentences: Geella asi ooshshaa denttees; zigirssanchcha asi ammanettiya laggeta shaakkees.

English Sentences: A violent man enticeth his neighbour, and leadeth him into the way that is not good.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gene asi ba shooruwaa cimmees; lo77o gidenna ogiyau i a kaalettees.

English Sentences: He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba aifiyaa qim77otiya asi geellabaa qoppees; ba menttershshaa saxxidi manddiya asi iitabaa polees.

English Sentences: The hoary head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of righteousness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Puulummida huuphee bonchcho kallachcha; hegeekka beettiyoi xillo de7uwaa de7iina.

English Sentences: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wolqqaama asa gidiyoogaappe, hanqqettanau eesotenna asa gidiyoogee lo77o; daro katamata olidi oiqqiyoogaappe, asi ba huuphiyaa haariyoogee aadhdhees.

English Sentences: The lot is cast into the lap; but the whole disposing thereof is of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi saamaa yeggees; shin GODAI ubbabaa battees.

English Sentences: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooshshai de7iyoosan de7iya gita gibiraappe saroinne woppai de7iyoosan mela oittaa poquwaa miyoogee keha.

English Sentences: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
Wolaitta Sentences: Cincca ashkkarai ba godaa na7aa pattenna laafaa haarees; yaatidi ishanttuura issippe laattees.

English Sentences: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the LORD trieth the hearts.
Wolaitta Sentences: Worqqainne birai taman paacettiyoogaadan, GODAI asaa wozanaa paaccees.

English Sentences: A wicked doer giveth heed to false lips; and a liar giveth ear to a naughty tongue.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi iita uraa haasayaa siyees; worddanchchaikka genanchchaa oduwaa ezggees.

English Sentences: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesatu bolli qilliicciya asi eta medhdhida Xoossaa cayees; hara asa gakkiya metuwan ufaittiya asi qaxxayettennan attenna.

English Sentences: Children's children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naatu naati cimida asatuyyo kallachcha; aawati bantta naatuyyo bonchcho.

English Sentences: Excellent speech becometh not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro lo77o haasayai eeyya uraassi giigenna; hegaappekka aaruwaa worddo haasayai deriyaa haariyaagaassi giigenna.

English Sentences: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it: whithersoever it turneth, it prospereth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mattaayee bana immiyaagau dumma wolqqa mala; i simmido soho ubbai ayyo injjetees.

English Sentences: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; but he that repeateth a matter separateth very friends.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naaqettidi ba naaquwaa genttiya urai siiquwaa koyees; shin yoho zaari zaaridi woociya urai, ammanettiya laggeta shaakkees.

English Sentences: A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyyai xeetuton lissuwan shocin eriyoogaappe akeeki de7iyo asi coo seerin eriyoogee aadhdhees.

English Sentences: An evil man seeketh only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi makkalabaa xalaalaa koyees; hegaa gishshau, meqetti bainna daanni a bolli kiitettana.

English Sentences: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyyatetti oiqqido uraara gaittiyoogaappe marata bonqqi ekkirggido maaheera gaittiyoogee keha.

English Sentences: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77o oottidoogaa kushiyaa iitaa zaariya uraayyo iitai a sooppe mulekka kichchenna.

English Sentences: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooshshai doommiiddi, zeeruwaa xuussiya haattaa mala; hegaa gishshau, ooshshaappe kasetada palamaa aggaaga.

English Sentences: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just, even they both are abomination to the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nagaranchchaa xillissiyoogeenne xilluwaa bolli pirddiyoogee eti naa77aikka GODAA sheneyiya ooso.

English Sentences: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he hath no heart to it?
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeekiya wozani au bainnaashin, eeyyaa kushiyan aadhdhida eratettaa shammiyo miishshai aibissi de7ii?

English Sentences: A friend loveth at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Laggee mule wodekka siiqees; ishaikka metuwaa wode maaddanaassi yelettees.

English Sentences: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeekai paccido asi erenna uraa acuwaa qanxxanau waase gelees.

English Sentences: He loveth transgression that loveth strife: and he that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooshshaa dosiya asi nagaraa dosees; ubbatoo ceeqettiya asi bashshaa ba bolli xeesees.

English Sentences: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into mischief.
Wolaitta Sentences: Geella qofai de7iyo asi lo77obaa demmenna; shikkaalobaa haasayiya asikka metuwan gelees.

English Sentences: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool hath no joy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azalla na7aa yelida aawi azzanees; eeyya na7aa aawau ufaissi baawa.

English Sentences: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozani ufaittiyoogee asassi lo77o xale; shin kayyottiyoogee asau wolqqaa xaissees.

English Sentences: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita daannai pirddaa geellayanau geeman mattaayiyaa ekkees.

English Sentences: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeekai de7iyo uri aadhdhida eratettaa sinttan wottidi bees; shin eeyyaa aifee biittaa sa7aa xanxxaa yuuyidi xeellees.

English Sentences: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bare him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azalla na7ai ba aawaa azzanissees; bana yelida aayyiyookka zil77issees.

English Sentences: Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asa qaxxayiyoogee, suure asakka a suuretettaa gishshau dechchiyoogee lo77o gidenna.

English Sentences: He that hath knowledge spareth his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Amarida qaala haasayiya asi eranchcha; woppa ayyaani de7iyo asikka akeekanchcha.

English Sentences: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya uri co77u giikkonne ba doonaa barikko, eranchcha milatees.

English Sentences: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh and intermeddleth with all wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaahettanau koyiya asi ba amuwaa kaallees; lo77o era ubbaakka phalqqees.

English Sentences: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyyai ba qofaa qonccissanaagaa xalaalaa dosiyoogaappe attin, hara asappe era ekkanau dosenna.

English Sentences: When the wicked cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitatettai yiyo wode, karee, kaushshinne yeelli a kaallidi yi bayoosona.

English Sentences: The words of a man's mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asaa doonaappe kiyiya haasayai ciimmaa haattaa mala; aadhdhida eratettaa pulttoikka goggiya haattaa mala.

English Sentences: It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mooranchchaa maaddidi, xilluwaa pirddaa geellayiyoogee lo77o gidenna.

English Sentences: A fool's lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asi ba haasayan ooshshaa denttees; a doonaappe kiyiya qaalai a warissees.

English Sentences: A fool's mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asi, haasayiiddi bana qohees; a haasayai gite gididi, a oiqqees.

English Sentences: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zigirssanchchaa qaalai mal77o qumaa mala; ufaissiiddi duge ganjjiyaa gakkees.

English Sentences: He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba oottiyo oosuwan azalliya asi bashshiya urappe ainne dummatenna.

English Sentences: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAA sunttai mino gimbbe mala; xillo asi yaa woxxidi saro attana.

English Sentences: The rich man's wealth is his strong city, and as an high wall in his own conceit.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin dure asatussi eta duretettai yuushoi gimbbettido katamaa mala; eta qofan eta duretettai mino dirssaadan eta naagiyaabaa milatees.

English Sentences: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi kunddanaappe kase a wozanai otorettees; bonchchettiyoogaappekka ba huuphiyaa ziqqi oottiyoogee sinttatees.

English Sentences: He that answereth a matter before he heareth it, it is folly and shame unto him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siyennan de7iiddi zaariyoogee, hegee he uraayyo eeyyatettanne yeella.

English Sentences: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
Wolaitta Sentences: Asa ayyaani harggiyaa danddayanaadan maaddees; shin ayyaani meqerettiichchikko, a ooni danddayanee?

English Sentences: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeekanchcha asati tamaaranau keehi koyoosona; aadhdhida eri de7iyoobaakka ezggoosona.

English Sentences: A man's gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Immiyoobi immiyaagau ogiyaa dooyees; gita asaarakka erissees.

English Sentences: He that is first in his own cause seemeth just; but his neighbour cometh and searcheth him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kasetidi daannan mootiya uri baarigaarai yiidi a oichchana gakkanaashin, ubbatonkka he urai xillo milatees.

English Sentences: The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saamaa yeggiyoogee palamaa teqqees; naa77u wolqqaama baarigaaratakka shaakkees.

English Sentences: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city: and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naaqettida ishaara giiganaagee gimbbettida katamaa omooddanaagaappekka aadhdhi waayissees; penggiyaa gorddiyo birata hiraquwaadan, palamai dabbota shaakkees.

English Sentences: A man's belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; and with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba doonan haasayidobaappe asi ba ganjjiyaa kunttees: ba inxxarssaappe kiyidaban kallees.

English Sentences: Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni haasayidoogee nena wottees woikko worees; hegaa gishshau, neeni ne haasayaa gaasuwan yiyaabaa ekkanau de7aasa.

English Sentences: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Machcho demmida asi lo77obaa demmiis; he urai GODANKKA nashettees.

English Sentences: The poor useth intreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesa asi auddashidi haasayees; shin duree phenqqeshidi zaarees.

English Sentences: A man that hath friends must shew himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro laggee de7iyo asi xayana; shin ishappe aadhdhidi ammanttiya laggee de7ees.

English Sentences: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.
Wolaitta Sentences: Worddo haasayaa haasayiya eeyyaappe ba de7on boree bainna hiyyeesa asi keha.

English Sentences: Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eri bainna minotai lo77o gidenna; hemettiiddi eesotiya uraikka wora bees.

English Sentences: The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi issi asai ba eeyyatettan ba de7uwaa bashshees; yaatidi qassi GODAA bolli yiillotees.

English Sentences: Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.
Wolaitta Sentences: Duretettai daro laggeta gujjees; shin hiyyeesatettai de7iya laggetakka duuttees.

English Sentences: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.
Wolaitta Sentences: Worddo markki qaxxayettennan beenna; wordduwaa haasayiyaageetikka kessi ekkokkona.

English Sentences: Many will intreat the favour of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro asai daannaa sinttaa koyees; coo immiya uraara asi ubbi dabbotees.

English Sentences: All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesa asa a ishantti ubbai ixxoosona; hegaappekka aaruwaa a laggeti appe haakkoosona; i eta auddashidi kaallinkka, eti a gatti oittokkona.

English Sentences: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaa demmiyaagee bana siiqees; akeekaa qoraphphiyaagee lo77obaa demmees.

English Sentences: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.
Wolaitta Sentences: Worddo markki qaxxayettennan attenna; wordduwaa haasayiyaageekka xayana.

English Sentences: Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azalla uraassi ishalo de7oi bessenna; hegaappekka aillee halaqata haariyoogee iitaa darees.

English Sentences: The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aawussi de7iya aadhdhida eratettai hanqquwaa mitissees; moorida urau atto giyoogeekka bonchchissees.

English Sentences: The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwaa hanqqoi gaammuwaa gudettaa mala; shin a nashettai maataa aacissiya akkaa mala.

English Sentences: A foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya na7ai ba aawaa xaissees; ooshshanchcha machchiyaakka keetti ubbaton aattiyo aato mala.

English Sentences: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi asi keettaanne aquwaa ba aawaappe laattanau danddayees; shin akeekanchcha machchiyo GODAI immees.

English Sentences: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.
Wolaitta Sentences: Coo zolppattiya uraayyo xiskkoi yees; ooso oottenna asi namisettees.

English Sentences: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azazuwaa naagidi oottiya asi, ba shemppuwaa naagees; shin shenehoo giya asi haiqqees.

English Sentences: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD; and that which he hath given will he pay him again.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesaassi kehiya asi GODAASSI tal77ees; GODAI he lo77o oosuwaa acuwaa qanxxees.

English Sentences: Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmiyo menttoi de7ishin, ne naata seera; seerana xayikko, neeni eta bashshadasa.

English Sentences: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hanqquwaa suulliya asi ba waagaa ekko; a aggaaga; neeni a ashshiyaaba gidikko, haranttuwaakka neeni a hegaadan oottanaagee attenna.

English Sentences: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zoriyaa siya; timirttiyaakka ekka. Yaatikko, neeni wurssettan aadhdhida eranchcha gidana.

English Sentences: There are many devices in a man's heart; nevertheless the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai darobaa halchchees; shin GODAI giidobai polettees.

English Sentences: The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asappe koyettiyaagee aggenna siiquwaa; worddanchcha gidanaappe hiyyeesa gidiyoogee keha.

English Sentences: The fear of the LORD tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAASSI yayyiyoogee de7uwau kaalettees; assi yayyiya asi kallidi de7ees; iitabikka a bochchenna.

English Sentences: A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi issi asai daro azalla; woxiyan tushkkido buddeenaakka pude baaranau waayettees.

English Sentences: Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni qilliicciyaagaa shocikko, akeekai paccidoogee cinccatettaa tamaarana; akeekanchcha asa neeni seerikko, i eratettaa demmana.

English Sentences: He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba aawaa bonqqiya na7ai, ba aayyiyookka sooppe kessidi yedettiya na7ai, he na7ai yeellaanne kaushshaa ehiya na7a.

English Sentences: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, neeni zoriyaa siyiyoogaa aggidabaa gidikko, erau zokkuwaa zaaradasa.

English Sentences: An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Worddo markkai suure pirddaa bolli qilliiccees; iita asaa doonai iitatettaa gubbidi mittees.

English Sentences: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qilliicciyaageetussi pirddai, eeyyatussikka warai koshshees.

English Sentences: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro mattoyiya ushshaa uyiyoogee daro bidisseesinne ooshshees; mattottiya asi wozani paccido asa.

English Sentences: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoso provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawo hanqqoi gaammuwaa gudettaa mala; a yiilloyiya asi ba shemppuwaa bolli pirddees.

English Sentences: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife: but every fool will be meddling.
Wolaitta Sentences: Palamaappe gaxan de7iyoogee aawussi bonchcho; shin eeyya asi ubbi ooyettanau eesotees.

English Sentences: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore shall he beg in harvest, and have nothing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azalla goshshanchchai wodiyaa naagidi goyenna; hegaa gishshau, kattaa cakkiyo wode i woossees; shin aibakka demmenna.

English Sentences: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of understanding will draw it out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asaa wozanaa halchchoi ciimma ollaa giddon de7iya haattaa mala; shin wozannaama asi hegaa duuqqidi kessees.

English Sentences: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: but a faithful man who can find?
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro asati bantta kehatettaa yootoosona; shin tumu ammanettiya asa demmanai oonee?

English Sentences: The just man walketh in his integrity: his children are blessed after him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asi boree bainna de7uwaa de7ees; a kaallidi, a naatikka anjjettidaageeta.

English Sentences: A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi pirddanau ba kawotaa araatan uttido wode, iita ubbaa ba aifiyan harqqidi kessees.

English Sentences: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta wozanaa geeshshaas; tanan nagarikka baawa" yaaganau danddayiya asi de7aneeshsha?

English Sentences: Divers weights, and divers measures, both of them are alike abomination to the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI worddo meezaanan yiggiyaageetanne likke gidennaban makkiyaageeta ixxees.

English Sentences: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7i geeshshanne suure gidiyoogee i oottiyo oosuwan erettees.

English Sentences: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, the LORD hath made even both of them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Siyiya haittaanne xeelliya aifiyaanne, eta naa77aakka GODAI medhdhiis.

English Sentences: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xiskkon ne wodiyaa wurssoppa; wurssikko neeni hiyyeesana. Beegotta; yaatikko, neeni kattaa kallana.

English Sentences: It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHammiya asi, "Qohees! Qohees!" yaagees; shin biidoogaappe guyyiyan, "Hiraisuwan shammaas" yaagiiddi ceeqettees.

English Sentences: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Erai kumido haasayai worqqaappekka inqquwaa giyo daro al77o shuchchaappekka aadhdhida al77obaa.

English Sentences: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger: and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
Wolaitta Sentences: Erenna asau waase geliya uraa maayuwaa qaari ekkite; imatta asau waase geliya uraa maayuwaa oiqqite.

English Sentences: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wordduwan demmido kattai asa mal77ees; shin aqi kiyiiddi, doonaa giddon shaahetaadan hanees.

English Sentences: Every purpose is established by counsel: and with good advice make war.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zoriyaa ekkada ne halchchiyoobaa halchcha; zore ekkennan de7aidda olau booppa.

English Sentences: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets: therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zigirssanchcha asi xuuraa genttenna; hegaa gishshau, odanchcha uraara gaittoppa.

English Sentences: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi ba aawaa woikko ba aayyiyo cayikko, a de7uwaa xomppe sakkana xuman to7ana.

English Sentences: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Koiroora eesuwan shiiqida aqoi wurssettan anjjettenna.

English Sentences: Say not thou, I will recompense evil; but wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeyyo iitaa oottida urau, taanikka ayyo iitaa oottana gooppa; GODAN ammanettada naaga; i nena ashshana.

English Sentences: Divers weights are an abomination unto the LORD; and a false balance is not good.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI naa77u qommo meezaanata shenetees; worddo meezaanatikka a ufaissokkona.

English Sentences: Man's goings are of the LORD; how can a man then understand his own way?
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai baanau bessiya ogiyaa GODAI kaalettees; yaatin, asi ba de7uwan baana ogiyaa waatidi akeekanau danddayii?

English Sentences: It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy, and after vows to make enquiry.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issibaa eesotidi, "Hagaa taani Xoossaassi immaas" girggiyoogeenne guyyeppe zil77ettiyoogee, hegee asa oiqqiya pire.

English Sentences: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchcha kawoi makkalanchchata shaakkidi erees; i etau qarettennan qaxxayees.

English Sentences: The spirit of man is the candle of the LORD, searching all the inward parts of the belly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asaa ayyaanai GODAAYYO xomppe; hegaa gishshau, i nu giddo asatetta ubbaa pilggi xeellees.

English Sentences: Mercy and truth preserve the king: and his throne is upholden by mercy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aggenna siiqoinne ammanettiyoogee kawuwaa naagoosona; a kawotaa araatai aggenna siiquwan minnees.

English Sentences: The glory of young men is their strength: and the beauty of old men is the grey head.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yelagatu bonchchoi eta wolqqaa; cimatuyyookka eta puulunttai etau bonchcho.

English Sentences: The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripes the inward parts of the belly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mino qixaatee iitatettaa shoddees; wadhdhiyoogee iita wozanaa laammanau danddayees.

English Sentences: The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD, as the rivers of water: he turneth it whithersoever he will.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwaa wozanai GODAA kushiyaana; i a wozanaa goggiya haattaa zaariyoogaadan, ba koyidosaa zaarees.

English Sentences: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes: but the LORD pondereth the hearts.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi oottiyoobai ubbai aawussi likke milatees; shin GODAI a wozanaa qofaa paaccees.

English Sentences: To do justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yarshshuwaa yarshshiyoogaappekka aattidi, xillobaanne suurebaa oottiyoogaa GODAI dosees.

English Sentences: An high look, and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, is sin.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitati otorettiyoogaaninne ayyiyoogan erettoosona; hegeekka nagara.

English Sentences: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mino oosanchchaa halchchoi dureyees; shin eesotiya ubbai hiyyeesana.

English Sentences: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of them that seek death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Worddotidi dagayido aqoi penttuwaa suuluwaadan xayees; hegaa koyiyaageeti haiquwaa koyoosona.

English Sentences: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them; because they refuse to do judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitati suurebaa oottanau ixxiyo gishshau, eta makkala oosoi eta ekkidi bees.

English Sentences: The way of man is froward and strange: but as for the pure, his work is right.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mooranchchati geella ogiyan hemettoosona; shin geeshshati suurebaa oottoosona.

English Sentences: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman in a wide house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooyettiya machcheera issi keettan de7iyoogaappe he keettaa shakkuwan de7iyoogee keha.

English Sentences: The soul of the wicked desireth evil: his neighbour findeth no favour in his eyes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitati iitabaa oottanau amottoosona; bantta shoorotussi qarettokkona.

English Sentences: When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise: and when the wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qilliicciyaagee qaxxayettido wode, wozani paccido urai aadhdhida eraa tamaarees; qassi wozannaama urai tamaaridi, eraa demmees.

English Sentences: The righteous man wisely considereth the house of the wicked: but God overthroweth the wicked for their wickedness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo Xoossai iitatu son oosettiyaabaa ubbaa be7ees; eta aatti yeggidi xaissees.

English Sentences: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself, but shall not be heard.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesaa waasuwaa siyanaappe giidi, ba haittaa tucciya uri, ikka waassana; waassin alliyaabai xayana.

English Sentences: A gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in the bosom strong wrath.
Wolaitta Sentences: Geeman immiyo imoi hanqquwaa doshissees. Afala giddoora immido mattaayee suulo hanqquwaa irxxissees.

English Sentences: It is joy to the just to do judgment: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suure pirddai pirddettido wode, hegee xilluwaassi ufaissa; shin iitaa oottiyaageetussi dagama.

English Sentences: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding shall remain in the congregation of the dead.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeeka ogiyaappe haddirida uraa haiqoi naagees.

English Sentences: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine and oil shall not be rich.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aaro injjiyan de7ana giya urai manqqees; woine eessanne zaite dosiya asi duretenna.

English Sentences: The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi issiton Xoossaasata ashshanau iita asati qaxxayettoosona; ammanettenna asatikka suure asatu gishshaa qaxxayettoosona.

English Sentences: It is better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious and an angry woman.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooyettiyanne yiillotiya machcheera de7anaappe bazzon de7iyoogee keha.

English Sentences: There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozannaama uraa son mal77o qumainne oissai minjjettees; shin eeyya asi bau de7iyaabaa ubbaa mirggees.

English Sentences: He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth life, righteousness, and honour.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillotettaanne aggenna siiquwaa koyiya uraa baree aduqqees; qassi he urai xillotettaanne bonchchuwaa demmees.

English Sentences: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty, and casteth down the strength of the confidence thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozannaama asi wolqqaama olanchchati de7iyo katamaa olidi oiqqees; oiqqidi eti ammanettido mino qatuwaakka laalees.

English Sentences: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue keepeth his soul from troubles.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba doonaanne ba inxxarssaa naagiya asi bana metuwaappe naagees.

English Sentences: Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.
Wolaitta Sentences: Otorettiyanne ayyiya asi qilliicciyaagaa geetettees; i otoranchcha gidido gishshau, asau qoppenna.

English Sentences: The desire of the slothful killeth him; for his hands refuse to labour.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azallaa amoi worees; aissi giikko, i oottanau koyenna.

English Sentences: He coveteth greedily all the day long: but the righteous giveth and spareth not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azallai gallassa kumettaa darobaa demmanau amottees; shin xilloi bau ashshennan immees.

English Sentences: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more, when he bringeth it with a wicked mind?
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI iitatu yarshshuwaa shenetees; hegaappekka eti au iita qofan shiishshiyo yarshshuwaa aatti shenetees.

English Sentences: A false witness shall perish: but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Worddo markkai xayana; shin qoppidi akeekan haasayiya uraa haasayai ehettana.

English Sentences: A wicked man hardeneth his face: but as for the upright, he directeth his way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi taagaa xalaalai likke gees; shin suure asi yuushshi qoppees.

English Sentences: There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi ba aadhdhida eratettan, akeekaaninne zoriyan GODAARA eqettanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: The horse is prepared against the day of battle: but safety is of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Olaayyo paraa kooranau danddayettees; shin olaa xoonissiyaagee GODAA.

English Sentences: A GOOD name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77o sunttai daro duretettaappe aadhdhees; sabettiyoogeekka biraappenne worqqaappe aadhdhees.

English Sentences: The rich and poor meet together: the LORD is the maker of them all.
Wolaitta Sentences: Duriyaanne manqquwaa ubbaakka GODAI medhdhiis; hegan eti naa77aikka lagge.

English Sentences: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.
Wolaitta Sentences: Cincca asi iitaa be7idi, qosetti aattees; shin akeeki paccido asi metuwan gelidi qohettees.

English Sentences: By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honour, and life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ashkke gidikkonne GODAASSI yayyikko, duretettaa, bonchchuwaanne de7uwaa demmana.

English Sentences: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita uraa ogiyan agunttainne piree de7ees; shin bana naagiya asi etappe haakkees.

English Sentences: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7i waanidi de7ana bessiyaakko tamaarissa; yaatikko, i cimidikka hegaa aggenna.

English Sentences: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
Wolaitta Sentences: Duree hiyyeesaa haarees; tal77i ekkidaagee tal77iyau immidaagau aille gidees.

English Sentences: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nagaraa zeriya urai waayiyaa cakkees; harata i tuggayiyo tuggaikka attees.

English Sentences: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
Wolaitta Sentences: Keha asi ba qumaappe hiyyeesau coo immiyo gishshau anjjettana.

English Sentences: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qilliicciya asa diggarggikko, palamai, ooshshainne cashshai kichchana.

English Sentences: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni wozanaa geeshshatettaanne kehaa haasayaa dosikko, kawoi nenaara dabbotees.

English Sentences: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI tumaa naagees; shin worddanchchatu qaalaa i aatti yeggees.

English Sentences: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azalla asi, "Taani kare kiyikko, gaammoi tana maana; tana ogiyan asi worana" yaagees.

English Sentences: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaaramuxa maccaasee doonai ciimma ollaa mala; GODAI hanqqettido uri a giddon kunddees.

English Sentences: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7a wozanaa azallatettai baqqi oiqqees; shin qaixaariyan qaxxayiyoogee appe haassees.

English Sentences: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baayyo aquwaa gujjana giidi, hiyyeesaa naaqqiyaageenne duriyaassi imuwaa immiyaagee naa77aikka hiyyeesana.

English Sentences: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne haittaa haa yeggada, aadhdhida eranchchai odiyoobaa siya; ne wozanaakka ta eraakko zaara.

English Sentences: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, eta ne wozanan wottikkonne ne doonankka eta ubbaa hassayikko, neeni ufaittana.

English Sentences: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne ammanoi GODAN gidana mala, taani nena - ee nena - hachchi tamaarissaas.

English Sentences: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani neessi zoreenne eratettai de7iyo hasttamu leemisota xaafoohoo!

English Sentences: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena kiittidaagaayyo neeni likke zaaruwaa zaarana mala, taani nena tumatettaa tamaarissaas.

English Sentences: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesatussi aibinne bainna gishshau, etabaa bonqqoppa; shilootankka metootanchchatu maataa xaissoppa.

English Sentences: For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, GODAI eta gishshaa mootettana; eta bonqqidaageetakka i bonqqana.

English Sentences: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:
Wolaitta Sentences: Hanqqettiya uraara laggetoppa; hanqqettanau eesotiya uraarakka zuppetoppa.

English Sentences: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni a hanuwaa meezetikko, guyyeppe agganau danddayakka.

English Sentences: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asassi aco ta qanxxana gaada waase geloppa.

English Sentences: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni qanxxiyoobi xayikko, ne zin77iyo hiixai attennan, neessi de7iyaabai ubbai ekettana.

English Sentences: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne maizza aawati tokkido beni zawaa shoddoppa.

English Sentences: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba oosuwaa cinccatettan oottiya asa be7adii? I kawotussi ootteesippe attin, coo asatussi oottenna.

English Sentences: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni deriyaa haariyaagaara qumaa maanau uttido wode, ne sinttan de7iyaagaa loittada akeeka.

English Sentences: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni daro yora asa gidikko, naagetta.

English Sentences: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.
Wolaitta Sentences: I nena paaccanau danddayiyo gishshau, aadhdhida mal77o qumau yiiqetoppa.

English Sentences: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Duretanau daafuroppa; hegaa mala keesiyaa agganau cincca gida.

English Sentences: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa mala duretettai neeni xeellishin xayana; qefiyaa kessidi argganttaagaadan, saluwaa paallana.

English Sentences: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:
Wolaitta Sentences: Uuziyaa qumaa mooppa; a mal77o qumaakka maanau amottoppa.

English Sentences: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Milatissanau i nena, "Ma; uya" yaageesippe attin, a wozanai nenaara de7enna.

English Sentences: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni miido qiiba qumaa cooyana; ne galataikka hada gidana.

English Sentences: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyyaassi payyabaa haasayoppa; aissi giikko, ne aadhdhida era haasayaa i karana.

English Sentences: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
Wolaitta Sentences: Beni zawaa shoddoppa; qassi aawi bainna naatu gadiyaa zawaa sugoppa;

English Sentences: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: aissi giikko, eta ashshiya GODAI mino; i eta gishshaa nenaara mootettana.

English Sentences: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne asttamaaree neessi odiyoogaa ezgga; ne haittaakka eraa qaalaakko yegga.

English Sentences: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.
Wolaitta Sentences: Na7a seerennan aggoppa; neeni a qaixaariyan wadhdhikko, i haiqqenna.

English Sentences: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni a qaixaariyan wadhdhikko, a shemppuwaa haiquwaappe ashshaasa.

English Sentences: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, neeni aadhdhida eranchcha gidikko, ta wozanaikka ufaittana;

English Sentences: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.
Wolaitta Sentences: ne inxxarssai suurebaa haasayiyo wode, ta wozanai ufaittees.

English Sentences: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nagaranchchata qanaatoppa; shin ubbatoo GODAASSI yayyiyoogaa aggoppa.

English Sentences: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaanikko neeyyo sinttanau sa7i kehana; sinttappe yaana kehikka neeyyo xayenna.

English Sentences: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, siya; wozannaama gida; ne wozanaa suure ogiyan wotta.

English Sentences: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro woine eessaa uyiyaageetuuranne ashuwaa muussau yaaretiyaageetuura zuppetoppa;

English Sentences: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.
Wolaitta Sentences: aissi giikko, mattottiyaageetinne yoranchchati manqqana; xiskkuwaa daroi asaa wurida curqqaa maizissees.

English Sentences: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena yelida ne aawai odiyoobaa siya; ne aayyiyaakka ceeggido wode karoppa.

English Sentences: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tumaa, aadhdhida eratettaa, timirttiyaanne akeekaa shammappe attin, mulekka baizzoppa.

English Sentences: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo na7aa aawai keehippe ufaittana; wozannaama na7aa yelida urikka an poccu gaana.

English Sentences: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne aawainne ne aayyiyaa ufaittona; nena yelidaarakka poccu gu.

English Sentences: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, ta zoriyaa ezgga; taani haniyoogaadan hana.

English Sentences: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, shaaramuxiya maccaasiyaa ciimma ollaa mala; laggettuwaa oiqqiya machchiyaakka un77o ollaa mala.

English Sentences: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.
Wolaitta Sentences: A panggadan zuggada naagausu; ammanettenna attumaasaa asaa giddon darissausu.

English Sentences: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Woo!" giyo waasoi oossee? Azzanoi oossee? Ooshshi oossee? Zuuzuntti oossee? Gaasoi bainnan masunxxiyai oonee? Aifee zo77iyoi oossee?

English Sentences: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.
Wolaitta Sentences: Woine eessaa uyiiddi gam77iyaageetussa gidennee? Walahettida woine eessaa uyi uyi be7iyaageetussa gidennee?

English Sentences: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.
Wolaitta Sentences: Woine eessai zo77ido wode, a merai birilliyaa giddon phooliyo wode, uyishin yalalattiiddi geliyo wode, a xeelloppa.

English Sentences: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wurssettan i shooshshadan dukkees; mulumuqqe shooshshadankka ba yiishshaa yiishshees.

English Sentences: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne aifee be7i erennabaa be7ana; ne wozanaikka suure qoppanaunne haasayanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni abbaa giddon dambbalai qaattiyo markkabiyaa xeeran zin77ida uraa mala gidana.

English Sentences: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni, "Eti tana dechchidosona; shin taani qohettabeikke. Eti tana wadhdhidosona; shin tau erettibeenna. Hara ushshaa uyanau taani aude denddanddinaashsha?" yaagana.

English Sentences: Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, iita asatu mala gidarkkinaashsha gooppa; etaara dabbotanaukka amottoppa;

English Sentences: For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.
Wolaitta Sentences: aissi giikko, eti ubbatoo makkalabaa maqettoosona; bantta inxxarssan genebaa haasayoosona.

English Sentences: Through wisdom is an house builded; and by understanding it is established:
Wolaitta Sentences: Keettai aadhdhida eratettan keexettees; akeekankka minnees.

English Sentences: And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.
Wolaitta Sentences: Erai de7ikko, qol77oi al77obaaninne lo77oban ubban kumees.

English Sentences: A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozannaama urau gita wolqqai de7ees; eranchcha asikka minotettaa gujjees.

English Sentences: For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counsellors there is safety.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni olau kiyanaappe kasetada halchchuwaa halchchana koshshees; daro zoriyaageetu zoriyan xoonoi beettees.

English Sentences: Wisdom is too high for a fool: he openeth not his mouth in the gate.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyyai aadhdhida eratettaa akeekanau danddayenna; au yaa7ankka odiyoobi aibinne baawa.

English Sentences: He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitaa oottanau halchchiya urai genanchcha geetettana.

English Sentences: The thought of foolishness is sin: and the scorner is an abomination to men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyyatettaa qofai nagara; asai qilliicciyaagaa ixxees.

English Sentences: If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni metuwaa gallassi laafikko, ne wolqqai guutta giyoogaa.

English Sentences: If thou forbear to deliver them that are drawn unto death, and those that are ready to be slain;
Wolaitta Sentences: Haiqqanau bessennan, haiquwau pirddidi efiyoogeeta ashsha; worana haniyo wode co77u gaada xeelloppa.

English Sentences: If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consider it? and he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it? and shall not he render to every man according to his works?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni, "Nuuni hagaa eribookko" yaagikko, wozanaa eriyaagee i be7ennee? Ne de7uwaa naagiyaagee erennee? Asa ubbau a oosuwaa oosuwaadan zaarennee?

English Sentences: My son, eat thou honey, because it is good; and the honeycomb, which is sweet to thy taste:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, eessaa ma; eessai lo77o. Eessaa ililoi manggaagan mal77ees.

English Sentences: So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaikka hegaa mala; i ne shemppuwau mal77o gidiyoogaa era. Neeni a demmiyaabaa gidikko, sinttaara yaana kehai neessa; neeni ekkana gaada ufaissan naagiyoobaikka xayenna.

English Sentences: Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; spoil not his resting place:
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilluwaa keettaanne aquwaa bonqqanau qoppiya iita asadan hanoppa.

English Sentences: For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asi laapputoo kunddikkokka denddees; shin iitati metuwan xayana.

English Sentences: Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne morkkee kunddiyo wode ufaittoppa; i xubettiyo wodekka, "Hashshu!" gooppa.

English Sentences: Lest the LORD see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ufaittikko, GODAI hegaa be7idi ufaittenna; a hanqqettiyoogaakka aggiigana.

English Sentences: Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked;
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitaa oottiyaageetu gishshau hirggoppa; eta mala gidarkkinaashsha gooppa.

English Sentences: For there shall be no reward to the evil man; the candle of the wicked shall be put out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, iita urau sinttaara yaana kehi baawa; iitatu xomppeekka to7ana.

English Sentences: My son, fear thou the LORD and the king: and meddle not with them that are given to change:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, GODAAYYOONNE kawuwaayyoo yayya; etayyo makkaliyaageetuurakka zuppetoppa.

English Sentences: For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, hegaa mala asata qoppenna metoi gakkees; kawuwaappenne GODAAPPE yaana metuwaa oonee eriyai?

English Sentences: These things also belong to the wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchati gujjidikka hagaadan yaagidosona: Pirddiiddi maaddiyoogee lo77o gidenna.

English Sentences: He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous; him shall the people curse, nations shall abhor him:
Wolaitta Sentences: Mooranchchaa, "Neeni moorabaakka" yaagiya daannaa asai qanggana; kawotettatikka a ixxana.

English Sentences: But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mooranchchaa qaxxayiyaageeti keehi nashettananne anjjettana.

English Sentences: Every man shall kiss his lips that giveth a right answer.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suure zaaruwaa zaariyoogee dabbotau malaata mala.

English Sentences: Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thine house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kasetada ne gadiyaa ootta; kattaakka zera; hegaappe guyyiyan, ne keettaa keexxa.

English Sentences: Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne shooruwaa bolli gaasoi bainnan markkattoppa; ne doonankka cimmoppa.

English Sentences: Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.
Wolaitta Sentences: "I tau oottidoogaadan, taani au oottana; taani au a oosuwaa kushiyaa zaarana" yaagoppa.

English Sentences: I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani issi gallassi, issi azallanne akeekai paccido bitaniyaa gaden de7iya woiniyaa turaa giddoora kanttaas.

English Sentences: And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kanttiyo wode, agunttainne sharafai goozi wottiis; yuushuwan de7iya shuchchaa gimbbeekka qolettiichchiis.

English Sentences: Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani a be7ido wode, qoppaas; taani be7idoogaappe timirttiyaa tamaaraas.

English Sentences: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni guuttaa liphphi ga; guuttaa xiskka; ne kushiyaakka shiishshada guuttaa shemppa ekka.

English Sentences: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, hiyyeesatettai panggadan yaana; pacaikka ola miishshaa oiqqida asadan puttu gaana.

English Sentences: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hageetikka qassi, Yihudaa Kawuwaa Hizqqiyaasa asati duuqqidi xaafido Solomona leemisota.

English Sentences: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xuuraa genttiyoogee Xoossaayyo bonchcho; xuuraa pilggidi kessiyoogee qassi kawotuyyo bonchcho.

English Sentences: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.
Wolaitta Sentences: Salotu xoqqatettaanne sa7aa ciimmatettaa asi gakkennaagaadan, kawotu qofaakka asi eranau danddayenna.

English Sentences: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biraappe shiyaa diggargga; hegaappe guyyiyan, wogaacee qoxxidi, lo77obaa kessana.

English Sentences: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwaa sinttappe iitata diggargga; yaatikko, a kawotaa araatai xillotettan minni eqqana.

English Sentences: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwaa sintti aadhdhiyo wode ceeqettoppa; gita asatuppe gidduwan soho koyoppa.

English Sentences: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeppe gitatiya asassi sohuwaa immanau halaqai nena denttin kauyyiyoogaappe, halaqai nena, "Hagaakko xoqqu ga" giyoogee neeyyo keha.

English Sentences: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne aifiyan be7idobaa markkattanau dabaabaa baanau eesotoppa; aissi giikko, neeni markkatta simmin, hara asi ne markkatettai bala gidiyoogaa qonccissikko, neeni yeellatana.

English Sentences: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeppenne ne shooruwaappe gidduwan palami merettikko, aara haasayada ne palamaa wurssa. Hara asa xuuraa qonccissoppa.

English Sentences: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegee xayikko, neeni odiyoogaa siyida asi nena kaushshana; hegan ne sunttai naa77antto simmennaadan moorettana.

English Sentences: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
Wolaitta Sentences: Koshshiyo wodiyan haasayettida likke qaalai biraa bolli tigido worqqaa alleequwaa mala.

English Sentences: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ezggiya uraa eranchcha asi zoriyo zoree haittan wottido worqqaa woikko geeshsha worqqaappe oottido alleequwaa mala.

English Sentences: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kattaa cakkiyo boniyan irxxa haattai uyin aliyoogaadan, kiittin ammanettiya asi bana kiittiyaageeta ufaissees.

English Sentences: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Immennabaa "Immana" yaagiiddi ceeqettiya asi iri bainna shaaraanne carkkuwaa mala.

English Sentences: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
Wolaitta Sentences: Danddayanchcha asi deriyaa haariyaagau odidi maizzees; liiqo qaalai meqettaa kanttidi gelees.

English Sentences: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eessaa demmikko, kallana gakkanaashin ma; shin darissikko, neeni cooyana.

English Sentences: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena uufidi ixxennaadan, ne shooruwaa soo ubbaton booppa.

English Sentences: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba shooruwaa bolli wordduwan markkattiya asi dullai, bisoinne qara zubbee asa qohiyoogaa keenaa qohees.

English Sentences: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
Wolaitta Sentences: Metuwaa wode ammanettenna uran zemppiyoogee qaaxxiya achchan coommiyoogaanne silida tohuwan hemettiyoogaa mala.

English Sentences: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azzani uttida asassi yettaa yexxiyoogee meego gallassi maayuwaa qaariyoogaanne masunttaa bolli caalabaa tigiyoobaa mala.

English Sentences: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne morkkee namisettikko, miza; saamettikko, ushsha.

English Sentences: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD shall reward thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, neeni hegaa oottiyoogee a huuphiyan tamaa bonqquwaa kaashidi qoliyoogaa mala. GODAIKKA neeyyo woitana.

English Sentences: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.
Wolaitta Sentences: Huuphessa bagga carkkoi iraa ehiyoogaadan, zigirssai hanqquwaa ehees.

English Sentences: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ooyettiya maccaaseera issi keettan de7anaappe son shakkuwaa huuphiyan de7iyoogee keha.

English Sentences: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daafurida uri irxxa haattaa uyidi aliyoogaadan, haaho biittaappe yiya lo77o odoi ufaissees.

English Sentences: A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita uraa eeshshaa tamaariya xillo asi bulqqotida pulttuwaanne moorettida olla haattaa mala.

English Sentences: It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro eessaa miyoogee lo77o gidenna; hegaadankka, ba bonchcho koyiyoogee bonchchissenna.

English Sentences: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba huuphiyaa naagenna asi dirssai meqqido katamaa mala.

English Sentences: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.
Wolaitta Sentences: Boniyan shachchai, kattaa cakkiyo wodiyankka irai koshshennaagaadan, eeyyau bonchchoi koshshenna.

English Sentences: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kafoti yaanne haanne paallidi, asa qohennaagaadan, gaasoi bainnan qanggiyo qanggetti asa gakkenna.

English Sentences: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool's back.
Wolaitta Sentences: Parau lissuwaa, hariyau poxooruwaa koshshiyoogaadan, azallaa zokkuwau waraa koshshees.

English Sentences: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya urau a eeyyatettaadan zaaroppa; zaarikko neenikka a mala gidana.

English Sentences: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya urau a eeyyatettaadan zaara; hinna xayikko, i bana eranchchadan qoodana.

English Sentences: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asa bolli kiitaa kiittiyoogee ba tohuwaa qanxxiyoogaanne woriyaabaa uyiyoogaa mala.

English Sentences: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya uraa leemisoi wobbe uraa tohuwaa mala maaddenna.

English Sentences: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya uraa bonchchiya asi shuchchaa yambbarshshaa bolli qachchi wottidi yambbariya asa mala.

English Sentences: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya uraa leemisoi mattottida asi ba kushiyaa caddida agunttaa kessanau baaxetiyoogaa mala.

English Sentences: The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asa woikko bau ogiyaara kanttiya asa oosossi qaxariya asi demmido asa ubbaa coo dukkiya wonddafiyaasa mala.

English Sentences: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.
