Wolaitta Sentences: Kanai ba cooshshaa guyye simmidi miyoogaadan, eeyyai ba eeyyatettaa oosuwaa zaari zaari oottees.

English Sentences: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Barkka bana, "Taani aadhdhida eranchchaa" giya asa be7adii? Appe eeyya urau sinttanaa lo77o qaadai de7ees.

English Sentences: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azallai, "Ogiyan gaammoi de7ees; yashshiya gaammoi aaho ogiyan yuuyees" yaagees.

English Sentences: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Penggee ba maaxafiyan yaanne haanne qaaxxiyoogaadan, azallaikka ba hiixan yaanne haanne aadhdhi wodhdhees.

English Sentences: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi issi asati daro azalla; eti harai attin, woxiyan tushkkido buddeenaakka pude baaranau daafuroosona.

English Sentences: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.
Wolaitta Sentences: Azalla asi markkaara odiya laappun eranchchatuppekka bana aadhdhida eranchcha giidi qoppees.

English Sentences: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bana gattiyaabi bainnasan palamau aadhdhiya asi ogiyaara biya kanaa haittaa oiqqiya asa mala.

English Sentences: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba shooruwaa cimmidi, "Taani kaassau oottaas" yaagiya asi,

English Sentences: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?
Wolaitta Sentences: gooyidi tamaa xiifaa oliya, woikko woriya zubbiyaa dukkiya asa mala.

English Sentences: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mittai wurikko, tamai to7ees; zigiriyaabi xayikko, ooshshai attees.

English Sentences: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xiixinttai bonqquwaa darissiyoogaadaaninne mittai tamaa darissiyoogaadan, amalanchcha asi ooshshaa darissees.

English Sentences: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zigirssanchchaa qaalai mal77o qumaa mala; ufaissiiddi duge ganjjiyaa gakkees.

English Sentences: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozanan iitabai de7ishin, ba inxxarssan cimo qaalaa haasayiya asi biran sheeshshido urqqa miishshaa mala.

English Sentences: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77o milatiya iita asi ba wozanan de7iya iitatettaa ba nasho haasayan genttees.

English Sentences: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: A wozanan laappun tunatettai kumi uttido gishshau, i lo77o qaalaa haasayikkokka a ammanoppa.

English Sentences: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba morkketettaa i genttikkokka, i oottiyo iitatettai yaa7an qonccana.

English Sentences: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haratussi ollaa bookkiya uri he ollan bau kunddana; haratu bolli shuchchaa gonddorssiya uraa bolli he shuchchai simmidi gonddorettana.

English Sentences: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
Wolaitta Sentences: Worddotiya inxxarssai ba qohido asata ixxees; sheleeshsho haasayai bashshaa ehaanaappe attin, harabaa eheenna.

English Sentences: Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonttoban ceeqettoppa; wonttoi ehaanabaa neeni erakka.

English Sentences: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena hara asi galatoppe attin, neeni nena nerkka galatoppa; asai ne gishshaa markkattoppe attin, neeni ne kehatettaa odoppa.

English Sentences: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool's wrath is heavier than them both.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHuchchai gita tooho; shaaheetaa tookkiyoogeekka deexo; shin eeyya urai denttiyo ooshshai eta naa77aappekka deexxees.

English Sentences: Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hanqqossi qareti baawa; yiilloikka bashshiya di7o mala; shin qanaatiyan ubba gattoppo.

English Sentences: Open rebuke is better than secret love.
Wolaitta Sentences: Geemmida siiquwaappe baliyo wode qoncciyan seeriyoogee keha.

English Sentences: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
Wolaitta Sentences: Morkkee nena darotoo yeriyoogaappe siiqoi nena dechchiyoogee keha.

English Sentences: The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kallida uraa eessaa ililoi iitees; shin namisettida uraa cammiyaabaikka mal77ees.

English Sentences: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba soo aggidi yuuyiya asi, ba keettaappe haakkada paalliya kafee mala.

English Sentences: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man's friend by hearty counsel.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHittoinne sawiya ixaani asaa ufaissiyoogaadan, siiqo laggiyaa zoreekka ufaissees.

English Sentences: Thine own friend, and thy father's friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother's house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne siiqo laggiyaanne ne aawaa siiqo laggiyaa aggoppa; nena metido wode ne ishaa soo booppa. Haahuwan de7iya ishaappe matan de7iya shooroi keha.

English Sentences: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta na7au, neeni aadhdhida eranchcha gida. Yaatiyaakko taani ufaittananne tana boriyaageetu oishaakka zaarana.

English Sentences: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.
Wolaitta Sentences: Cincca asi metoi yiyo wode be7idi qosettees; shin akeekai paccido asi sitti gi biidi, metuwan gelees; yaatidi guyyeppe wai ana gees.

English Sentences: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
Wolaitta Sentences: Erenna asau waase geliya uraa maayuwaa qaari ekkite; imatta asau, waase gelida uraa maayuwaa oiqqite.

English Sentences: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maallado guuran ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi, ba shooruwaa sarotiyoogee a qanggiyoogaa mala.

English Sentences: A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.
Wolaitta Sentences: Walassada duuxxenna machchiyaanne irai bukkin xokkidi aggenna aatoi issi mala.

English Sentences: Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself.
Wolaitta Sentences: Carkko teqqanau woikko zaite cuccumidi oiqqanau danddayettennaagaadan, o co77u oottanau danddayettenna.

English Sentences: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biratai birataa poshiyoogaadan, asai issoi issuwaappe tamaarees.

English Sentences: Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.
Wolaitta Sentences: Balase giyo mittiyo ishalissidi naagida uri i aifiyaa maana; bana aissidaagaa kabboyiya ashkkarai bonchchettana.

English Sentences: As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haattai heregaadan som77uwaa bessiyoogaadan, aawu wozanai aawu eeshshaa bessees.

English Sentences: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haiqoinne bashshi kalli erokkona; hegaadankka, asa amoi kallenna.

English Sentences: As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise.
Wolaitta Sentences: Birainne worqqai taman paacettidi geeyiyoogaadan, asikka ba ekkiyo galatan paacettees.

English Sentences: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asa kattaara udulan yeggada, udula mittan caddiyaakko, appe eeyyatettai kichchenna.

English Sentences: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne dorssati de7iyo hanotaa loittada era; ne mehiyaa wudiyaakka wozanappe heemma.

English Sentences: For riches are not for ever: and doth the crown endure to every generation?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, duretettai merinau de7enna; kallachchaikka yeletaappe yeletau aadhdhennan agganau danddayees.

English Sentences: The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mela maatai buucettidoogaappe, aaca maatai kiyidoogaappenne deriyaa bollan de7iya maatai shiiqidoogaappe guyyiyan,

English Sentences: The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of the field.
Wolaitta Sentences: dorssatu ikisiyaappe neeni neeyyo maayiyoobaa kessana; deeshshata baizzido birankka neeyyo gadiyaa shammana.

English Sentences: And thou shalt have goats' milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens.
Wolaitta Sentences: Attiya deeshshatu maattai neessi, ne so asaassinne ne macca ashkkaratussi quma gidana.

English Sentences: The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitati ooninne yedettennan baqatoosona; shin xilloti gaammo mala xala.

English Sentences: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi kawotettai nagaranchcha gidikko, a haariyaageeti laametti laamettidi haaroosona. SHin kaalettiyaageeti aadhdhida eranchchanne akeekanchcha gidiyo wode, mino gididi, daro wodiyaa takkees.

English Sentences: A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesata huqqunniya hiyyeesa daannai kattaa xaissiya wolqqaama iraa mala.

English Sentences: They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Higgiyaa bonchchenna urai mooranchchaa sabbees; shin higgiyaa bonchchiyaagee mooranchchatu qofaa phalqqees.

English Sentences: Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all things.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asatussi suure pirddaabai gelenna; shin GODAASSI goinniyaageetussi ubbabaikka gelees.

English Sentences: Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.
Wolaitta Sentences: Geella asa gididi, dure gidiyoogaappe suure asa gididi, hiyyeesa gidiyoogee keha.

English Sentences: Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father.
Wolaitta Sentences: Higgiyaa naagiya wodallai akeekanchcha. SHin pattenna shufurotuura zuppetiyaagee ba aawaa yeellayees.

English Sentences: He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.
Wolaitta Sentences: Miishshaa dichchau immiyoogaaninne bonqqiyoogan duretiya asi he aquwaa hiyyeesatussi kehiya asassi shiishshees.

English Sentences: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer shall be abomination.
Wolaitta Sentences: Higgiyaa siyanaappe giidi, ba haittaa wora zaariya uraa woosai GODAA sheneyiyaabaa.

English Sentences: Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good things in possession.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suureta iita ogiyaa kaalettiya uri ba bookkido ollan bau kunddana; shin geeshsha asi lo77obaa laattana.

English Sentences: The rich man is wise in his own conceit; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dure asi bana aadhdhida eranchcha giidi qoppees; shin akeekai de7iyo hiyyeesai a paaccees.

English Sentences: When righteous men do rejoice, there is great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilloti xoonido wode, asai ubbai ufaittees; shin iitati maataa oiqqido wode, asai qosettees.

English Sentences: He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba nagaraa genttiya uri aacenna; shin paaxiyaageenne nagaraa aggiyaagee maarettana.

English Sentences: Happy is the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAAYYO ubbatoo yayyiya asi anjjettidaagaa; shin ba wozanaa dammissiya asi meton gelana.

English Sentences: As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; so is a wicked ruler over the poor people.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesa asaa haariya iita daannai gudiya gaammuwaanne namisettida godariyaa mala.

English Sentences: The prince that wanteth understanding is also a great oppressor: but he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozani paccido daannai ba asaa naaqqees; shin asa naaqqiyoogaa ixxiyaagee daro laittaa haarana.

English Sentences: A man that doeth violence to the blood of any person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asa worida asi haiqqana gakkanaashin baqatiiddi de7ees; a ooninne shiishshi ekkenna.

English Sentences: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.
Wolaitta Sentences: Boree bainnan hemettiya uri qohettennan attana; shin geella asi issi kuttan kunddana.

English Sentences: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba gadiyaa oottiya urai kattaa kallees. SHin shufurota kaalliya urai ubbatoo hiyyeesidi de7ees.

English Sentences: A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ammanettida urai daro anjjettana; shin duretanau jaamiyaagee qaxxayettennan attenna.

English Sentences: To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaakkidi maaddiyoogee lo77enna; shin asi guutta oittaa gishshau giidikka, shaakkidi maaddees.

English Sentences: He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Uuzettiya urai duretanau jaamees; bana hiyyeesatetti oiqqanaagaakka erenna.

English Sentences: He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asa coo sabbiya uraappe seeriya uri guyyeppe galatettees.

English Sentences: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression; the same is the companion of a destroyer.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba aawaappenne ba aayeeppe wuuqqidi, "Taani ainne nagara oottabeikke" yaagiya urainne bashshiya urai issi mala.

English Sentences: He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be made fat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaaretiya urai ooshshaa denttees; shin GODAN ammanettiyaagee kallees.

English Sentences: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
Wolaitta Sentences: Banan ammanettiya asi eeyya; shin aadhdhida eratettan hemettiyaagee saro de7ees.

English Sentences: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesau immiya urau paccenna; shin eta be7anaappe giidi qilimmiyaagee qanggettaa ekkana.

English Sentences: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asati sunttettiyo wode, asai qosettees; shin eti xayiyo wode, xilloti corattoosona.

English Sentences: He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daroton seerin ixxidi, morgge zozzida urai hassayennan meqqana; he urau paxoikka baawa.

English Sentences: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asati sunttettiyo wode asai ufaittees; shin iitati biittaa haariyo wode asai oolees.

English Sentences: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eraa dosiya asi ba aawaa ufaissees; shin shaaramuxa maccaasatu heeran yuuyiya asi ba miishshaa wurssees.

English Sentences: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tumaa pirddiya kawoi ba kawotettaa woppu oottees; shin mattaaye maanau yiiqetiyaagee ba kawotettaa bashshees.

English Sentences: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba shooruwaa sabbidi haasayiya urai, a tohuwaassi gitiyaa yeggees.

English Sentences: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi gitee oiqqiyoogaadan, ba nagaran oiqettees; shin xillo asi ufaittanaunne yexxanau danddayees.

English Sentences: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo asi hiyyeesaa maataa erees; shin iita asi hegaa mala eraa mulekka erenna.

English Sentences: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qilliicciyaageeti kataman ooshshaa denttoosona; shin aadhdhida eranchcha asati hanqquwaa gabbissoosona.

English Sentences: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchcha asi eeyya asa pirdda keettaa efiikko, eeyyai hanqqetteesinne qirees; au yaatobare saroi xayees.

English Sentences: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suutta gussanau jaamiya asati suure asa ixxoosona; qassi xillo asakka woranau koyoosona.

English Sentences: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asi ba hanqquwaa yeddi bessees; shin aadhdhida era asi ba hanqquwaa mittees.

English Sentences: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi sunttettida urai worddo odo ekkikko, a oosanchchati ubbai iita kiyoosona.

English Sentences: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the LORD lighteneth both their eyes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesinne asa naaqqiya asi issibaa koxxoosona; eta naa77aa aifiyaakka GODAI xeelissees.

English Sentences: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi kawoi hiyyeesassi suure pirddikko, i ba kawotettan gam77ana.

English Sentences: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qaixaareenne seeri naatussi aadhdhida eraa immees; shin yedan diccida na7i ba aayyiyo kaushshees.

English Sentences: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asati dariyo wode, nagarai darees; shin xilloti eta kunddettaa be7ana.

English Sentences: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne na7aa seera; yaatikko, i nena saruwaa diggenna; i nena ufaissana.

English Sentences: Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI kaalettiyo kaaletuwaa ekkenna deree yeda; shin higgiyaa naagiya uri anjjettidaagaa.

English Sentences: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ashkkari coo odo xalaalan seeretti erenna; odoi au geliyaakkokka i azazettenna.

English Sentences: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eesuwan eesuwan haasayiya uraa be7a eraishsha? Appe eeyya uraassi sinttanau daro ufaissai de7ees.

English Sentences: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne ashkkaraassi naatettan doommin, i koyiyoobaa ubbaa ayyo imma meezeyikko, issi gallassi neeyyo de7iyaabaa ubbaa ekkanau i kajjeelanaagee attenna.

English Sentences: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hanqqettiya asi ooshshaa denttettees; elle yiillotiya asi daro nagaraa oottees.

English Sentences: A man's pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Otoroi asa kaushshees; shin ziqqi giya ayyaanai de7iyo asi bonchchettees.

English Sentences: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kaisoora shaakkiya uri bana ixxiya asa; i dabaaban tumaa odikkokka qaxxayettees; tumaa odana xayikko qassi, GODAI a qaxxayana.

English Sentences: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be safe.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asassi yayyiyoobi he aawussi pire gidees; shin GODAN ammanettiya asi saro de7ees.

English Sentences: Many seek the ruler's favour; but every man's judgment cometh from the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daroti sunttatettai de7iyo asata auddashoosona; shin suure pirddai GODAA achchappe beettees.

English Sentences: An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xilloti nagaranchchata shenetoosona; nagaranchchatikka suure uraa shenetoosona.

English Sentences: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hagaappe kaallidi xaafettidaagee Yaaqe na7ai Aguri haasayido hayyo haasayaa. He bitanee Iteelassinne Ukaalassi hagaa haasayiis.

English Sentences: Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tumu taani ai asappekka eeyyaa darais; asassi de7iya akeeki taassi de7enna.

English Sentences: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani aadhdhida eraa tamaarabeikke; Geeshsha Xoossaabaakka aibanne erikke.

English Sentences: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what is his name, and what is his son's name, if thou canst tell?
Wolaitta Sentences: Saluwaa pude kiyidi, duge wodhdhidai oonee? Carkko ba kushen oiqqidai, haatta ba afalan yiicidai, sa7aa gaxaa a sohuwan sohuwan wottidai oonee? Ane erikko a sunttaa taayyo oda. A na7aa oona giyo?

English Sentences: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai odiyo qaalai ubbai tuma; baakko baqatidi biya ubbaassi i gonddalle.

English Sentences: Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
Wolaitta Sentences: A qaalaa bolli aibanne gujjoppa; gujjikko i nena seerana; neeni worddanchcha gidiyoogaakka i qonccissana.

English Sentences: Two things have I required of thee; deny me them not before I die:
Wolaitta Sentences: Abeet GODAU, taani nena naa77ubata oichchais; taani haiqqana gakkanaashin, eta tana diggoppa.

English Sentences: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:
Wolaitta Sentences: Koiruwan, taani asa cimmennaadaaninne worddo haasayennaadan tana naaga; naa77anttuwan, taayyo koshshiya keesa qumaa immappe attin, tana dure woikko manqqo kessoppa.

English Sentences: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the LORD? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my God in vain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hinna xayikko, dure gidada, "GODAI oonee?" gaada nena kaddana; woikko manqqo gidada, wuuqqana; yaatada ta Xoossaa sunttaa cayissana.

English Sentences: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena qanggenna malanne i qanggin neeyyo gometenna mala, ashkkaraa a godaa sinttan boroppa.

English Sentences: There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bantta aawata qanggiyaanne bantta aayeta anjjenna asati de7oosona.

English Sentences: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro tunaa tuni uttidi, banttana geeshshadan qoodiya asati de7oosona.

English Sentences: There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.
Wolaitta Sentences: Otoruwaa meexxiya asatinne asa karidi xeelliya asati de7oosona.

English Sentences: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta achchai biso mala gidin, eta manggaagai billama mala gidin, hiyyeesatanne metootanchchata naaqqidi, etabaa bonqqiya asati de7oosona.

English Sentences: The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ullatteessi naa77u macca naati de7oosona. Eti, "Hamma! Hamma!" yaagidi waassoosona. Mulekka kalli erenna heezzubati de7oosona; oiddanttoi qassi mule, "Gidana" gi erenna.

English Sentences: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not filled with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegeetikka: duufuwaa, maine maccaasaa, haatti kalissi erenna mela biittaanne, "Tau gidana!" gi erenna tamaa.

English Sentences: The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba aawaa baceessiya na7aa aifiyaa, ba aayyiyaa cimin kariya na7aa aifiyaa, zanggaaran de7iya quuroti woocana; a ashuwaa ankkoti maana.

English Sentences: There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana heezzubati maalalissoosona; oiddanttoi ubba taayyo gelenna.

English Sentences: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegeetikka: arggantti saloora paalliyo paaluwaa, shooshshi shuchchaa bollaara sololiyo sololettaa, markkabee abbaa bollan solddiyo soldduwaanne wodallinne geela7oi siiqotaa doommiyo doomettaa.

English Sentences: Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaaramuxa maccaasiyaa haniyo hanoikka hegaa mala. A muussaa mausu; shin miidoogaappe guyyiyan, ba doona quccarggada, "Taani ainne moorabeikke" yaagausu.

English Sentences: For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:
Wolaitta Sentences: Heezzu yohotun biittai qaaxxees; oiddanttuwaa ubba tookkanaukka danddayibeenna.

English Sentences: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegeetikka: aillee kawotido wode, eeyyai kattaa kallido wode,

English Sentences: For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.
Wolaitta Sentences: asi ixxido maccaasiyaa azina gelido wodenne macca ashkkariyaa ba godiyo laattido wode merettiya hanotaa.

English Sentences: There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7aa bolli oiddu guutta meretati de7oosona; shin eti keehi aadhdhida eranchcha.

English Sentences: The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegeetikka: Cunccalleta - cunccalleti wolqqi bainna mereta; shin banttau miyoobaa bone shiishshidi, minjjoosona.

English Sentences: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;
Wolaitta Sentences: Guppalleta - guppalleti guutta wolqqai de7iyoogeeta; shin bantta keettaa shuchchaa kooppuwan keexxoosona.

English Sentences: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;
Wolaitta Sentences: Booleta - booletussi kawoi baawa; shin eti ubbaikka maaran mankkan zattoosona.

English Sentences: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings' palaces.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zareta - zareti kushiyan oiqqinkka oiqettoosona; shin eti harai attin, kawo keettankka de7oosona.

English Sentences: There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:
Wolaitta Sentences: Bantta maataa bessiiddi hemettiya heezzu meretati de7oosona; oiddanttoikka lo77o hemetaa hemettees.

English Sentences: A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegeetikka: do7a ubbaappe minniyanne yayyidi baqati erenna gaammuwaa;

English Sentences: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.
Wolaitta Sentences: inddetu giddon ayyiiddi hemettiya adde kuttuwaa, deeshsha orggiyaanne ba olanchchatu giddon eqqiya kawuwaa.

English Sentences: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni eeyyada otorettidabaa gidikkonne, iitabaa oottanau halchchidabaa gidikko, ane takki gaada qoppa.

English Sentences: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maattaa bukkiyoogee oissaa kessiyoogaadan, siiriyaa yimppiyoogeekka suuttaa ehiyoogaadan, hegaadan hanqquwaa denttettiyoogee ooshshaa ehees.

English Sentences: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hagaappe kaallidi xaafettida hayyo haasayai, Kawuwaa Limu7eela aayyiyaa Kawuwaa Limu7eela tamaarissidoogaa.

English Sentences: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Laa ta na7au, ta uluwaappe wodhdhidaagoo, taani shiiqettada yelidoogoo,

English Sentences: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.
Wolaitta Sentences: maccaasan ne wolqqaa wurssoppa; he kawota bashshiya maccaasatun ne akataa xaissoppa.

English Sentences: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Limu7eelaa, hagee kawotussi bessenna; woiniyaa eessaa uyiyoogee kawotussi bessenna; mattoyiya ushshaa uyiyoogee deriyaa bolli sunttettidaageetussi bessenna.

English Sentences: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti uyiyo wode higgiyaa baloosona; balidi naaqettida asaa maataa shenehoo goosona.

English Sentences: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mattoyiya ushshaa haiqqana haniya uraunne sa7ai iitido urau immite.

English Sentences: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta manqqotettaanne bantta tugga de7uwaa dogana mala uyona.

English Sentences: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Bantta metuwaa odanau danddayennaageetu gishshaa neeni oda; maaddiyaabi bainnaageetu maataa gishshau neeni bidda.

English Sentences: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biddada etayyo suure pirddaa pirdda; hiyyeesatunne metootanchchatu maataa naaga" yaagada tamaarissaasu.

English Sentences: Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wozannaama machcho ooni demmanau danddayii? Inqquwaa giyo al77o shuchchaappekka a al77ausu.

English Sentences: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.
Wolaitta Sentences: I keettaawai o ubbabankka ammanees; ayyo de7anau bessiyaabaappe aibinne paccenna.

English Sentences: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ba de7o laitta ubban ayyo lo77obaappe attin, iitabaa oottukku.

English Sentences: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.
Wolaitta Sentences: Suufiyaanne liinuwaa a koyada, ufaittaidda ba kushiyan oottausu.

English Sentences: She is like the merchants' ships; she bringeth her food from afar.
Wolaitta Sentences: A zal77anchchatu markkabetu mala; ba qumaa haaho biittaappe ehausu.

English Sentences: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ba so asaassi qumaa kattanaunne ba macca ashkkaratussi oosuwaa bazzanau, sa7ai biron qamma de7ishin denddausu.

English Sentences: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gadiyaa a koyada shammausu; ba kushiyan oottada demmido miishshan woiniyaa turaa tokkausu.

English Sentences: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.
Wolaitta Sentences: A gooba oosanchcha gidiyoogaa xalaala gidennan, minonne cincca asa.

English Sentences: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ba woriyaa demmanau minnada zal77ausu; a oottaidda qamissiyo, ba xomppiyaa eesuwan toissukku.

English Sentences: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ba hinddiriitan suqqada, ba afalaa daddausu.

English Sentences: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
Wolaitta Sentences: A hiyyeesatussinne metootanchchatussi babaappe coo immausu.

English Sentences: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.
Wolaitta Sentences: I so asai ubbai ho77iya maayuwaa maayido gishshau, shachchai bukkiyaakko, a hirggukko.

English Sentences: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.
Wolaitta Sentences: Arssaa bollan hiixxiyo maayuwaa sikkausu; liinuwaappe dadettida zo7o maayuwaakka baayyo maayausu.

English Sentences: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dere cimati shiiqiyo dubbushan i keettaawai bonchchettida asa.

English Sentences: She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
Wolaitta Sentences: Liinuwaappe maayuwaanne qabattuwaa ootta oottada, zal77anchchatussi baizzausu.

English Sentences: Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.
Wolaitta Sentences: A minonne bonchcho asa; yiya laittatussi a mulekka hirggukku.

English Sentences: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eran a haasayausu; ammanttiya zoree i inxxarssaappe kiyees.

English Sentences: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ba so asaa de7uwaa injjeyanau ubbaton ooso oottaidda de7ausu; azalla hanoi i bollan beetti erenna.

English Sentences: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.
Wolaitta Sentences: I naati denddi eqqidi, o nashshoosona; i keettaawaikka o galatiiddi,

English Sentences: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Lo77obaa oottida daro maccaasati de7oosona; shin neeni eta ubbaappe aadhdhaasa" yaagees.

English Sentences: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mera lo77otetti allaalle kessenna; puulikka xayana; shin GODAASSI yayyiya maccaasiyaa, a galatettanau bessausu.

English Sentences: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.
Wolaitta Sentences: A oottidobau ubbau iyyo i kushiya zaarite; a oottido oosoi ubbai dabaaban o galatisso.
